Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY AWESOME!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mpayneSarniaOnCanada
Reviews.Content: We came here for our honeymoon in Aug. 2011. This hotel is very clean, the staff are so nice. The entire area is so beautiful. The weather was perfect. We rented a car, absolutely the best thing we did. San Diego has so much to offer. We will definitely be back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “BETTER THAN EXPECTED”
Reviews.Author: Timeseeker
Reviews.Content: This was a two night stay in a series of four hotels on a week long trip for eight family members. This hotel was booked in a last minute decision due to a change of plans, so little research was done on it. This facility is a series of free standing buildings located in an area that gives the appearance of a tropical island. The first building contained the office and on location restaurant. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful throughout the two days. It appears that they are renovating the buildings one at a time. The one we were assigned to appeared to have already been renovated. It was very clean new looking and the rooms were clean and comfortable. The location is ideal as far as getting to local attractions and only minutes to downtown San Diego. On departure day, had breakfast in their restaurant. It was good, but average. Reasonable pricing. Would without a doubt stay there again. We visit CA. frequently.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: JMurph40
Reviews.Content: I'm a native of San Diego so I visit a lot. If I'm not staying with friends, I always stay on Shelter Island because I never went there when I lived there and it feels more like a vacation. This was my first time at the Best Western though and I will always book my stay with them when I'm in town. They had great customer service, they offer free parking, there are two pools, a laundry room and the room was very nice to boot! Our bed was very comfortable, the amenities are great, Shelter Island is a great place to walk. I could go on forever! Definitely consider staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: bonmyster
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel early (around noon), they gave us our room right away. This location on Shelter Island is very close to the airport and lots of other attractions. The room was recently upgraded and had a nice view of the pool and marina. The restaurant has a happy hour with half price drinks and appetizers. We only stayed 2 nights here but wished we had longer. There is free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “I could hear everything my neighbors were saying”
Reviews.Author: love2travel277
Reviews.Content: There is one complaint i have about this hotel - very thin walls. May be in some other rooms it is better but they gave us a room on the first floor with a view of the parking lot. That was fine with us because the room was clean, bed was comfortable, wifi worked fine and we really did not care much about the view because we were out most of the time. In the evening when we came back, our neighbors in the room right of us had also arrived at the same time. I literally was hearing everything they were saying to each other. They were not even talking loud. Thanks God we did not have anyone in the room on the left side of us or anyone upstairs above us. So i was sitting there using my computer and listening to some guy talking to his children. I could hear everything he was saying just as if they were in the same room with me. Same story in the morning. They woke up and i had to wake up because they were talking and it was like they were right next to me. I have never been in a hotel with such thin walls in my life, and i have been traveling a lot. I don't think i will stay there again. I would rather spend $180 per night at some other hotel where i don't have to listen my neighbors' private conversations .

Reviews.Title: “Quick get away from Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Larry R
Reviews.Content: We saw this place the last time we went down to San Diego and wanted to stay there the next time we made it down. We did and it was very nice. The room faced the bay so we had lots to watch from the balcony. Big Navy ships, cruse ships, sail boats of every size, and just watching the people doing there thing in the small park across the street from us. But, most of all it is close to three of our favorite restaurants. First, Phil's B.B.Q at 3750 Sports Arena Blvd. (closed mondays). The best baby back pork ribs ever! Second, Blue Water Seafood Market and Grill. Not fancy! You eat off plastic plats and plastic knives and forks, but, the food more than makes up for that. They are at 3667 India St. Parking is not good. and Third is El Indio, again plastic but real Mexican food. They have been there since 1940, they make there corn Tortillas fresh everyday! The last day we were there we found a breakfast place called the Broken Yoak, be hungery. OK, this was not the best time of year to go, spring break but, we had another good time and I hope that this will help you out.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel! Staycation at it's finest!”
Reviews.Author: PGSevenSeas
Reviews.Content: My family lives in San Diego and when we need a short getaway, our go-to hotel is the Best Western Island Palms. The rooms are wonderful; modernly designed with warmth and taste and plenty of room to stretch out. The staff was great; very nice and always helpful. Our kids love the pool and we always get pool service for lunch which has always been delivered promptly, with the order correct and fresh & hot(when appropriate). Easy, complimentary parking and great water views over San Diego Bay on one side and a wonderful marina view on the otherside, it's a win-win no matter where your room is at this awesome hotel! Thank you Best Western Island Palms!

Reviews.Title: “Great views,accessible to many areas, great Spring break!”
Reviews.Author: Arawatbuwan
Reviews.Content: Stayed April 3-5, 2012 for spring break. Island Palms hotel and marina has great view of the bay and the dock yachts. Their pool is very child friendly 3-5 ft deep only with lots of lounge chairs for adults to relax (background view is the yachts). Free clean towels to use at poolside and fireplace to warm up cold kids out of the pool. You can walk along the bay and watch boats and ships along the waters. The pier where you can fish (bring fishing stuff if u love to fish) is right in front of the Casa Marina building. There were pelicans, pigeons, heron and ducks all around. There is also a small park where the kids can play. We even played badminton on the grassy areas. We saw some families with their tents set up for a picnic. Choose a 2nd or 3rd floor room at Casa Marina so you can enjoy these views because you can see cars only if you are on the 1st floor. There's an elevator on this building. Our room is on the 3rd floor, 2 queen beds, enough for 2 adults and 3 small kids. There's a microwave, tv, refrigerator, and best if free wifi and free parking. Will definitely come back more more staycations here.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Chris M
Reviews.Content: I booked my family vacation through southwest airlines. Couldn't beat the value anywhere else online. It was between 3 different hotels and this one won out because there prices fluctuated very little compared to other hotels over a 3 month period. I was watching prices to see and plan my budget once my bonus money came in. It was a beautiful hotel, well cared for, great service, nice pools, close to downtown and other attractions, quiet, awesome views of downtown and the bay, great areas to walk, a playground for children, close to starbucks and I could go on and on. If you like to eat at locally owned restaurants, there are a bunch around the neighborhood. Would highly recommend to those bringing a family. Will come back again, and hopefully sooner rather than later.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break”
Reviews.Author: 1970mx4
Reviews.Content: We spent an entire week here and loved the location! We stayed in room 118 and the view was awesome. The kids loved the pool and hot tub. We had 4 kids ages 17 to 7 and everyone had a wonderful time. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value. Great location. Great views!”
Reviews.Author: tmich396
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our "babymoon" to San Diego and choose this hotel for our stay. I was a little hesitant about booking a Best Western only because I was looking for something really special for our trip. We saw the good reviews on tripadvisor and decided to give it a try. It was everything we could have asked for. We loved the location, although not downtown, because it was like a little quiet place to get away after doing our day activities. We stayed in one of the newer buildings and had a view of the marina with quick access to the pool/hot tub from our back porch. The back porch was awesome in the evening to sit out, have a beverage, and unwind. Our room was very spacious, the bed was super comfortable, and a very large flat screen was in our room. There was no charge for parking which is almost always charged from my research at the downtown hotels. The price just can't be beat in my opinion... and my wife and I were super pleased! One piece of advice, if you stay here and are going to do sight seeing, you will definitely need a car. We found that parking was really reasonable if not free in almost all of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: T T
Reviews.Content: The staff was super friendly! They were knowledgeable about the area and had several recommendations about restaurants and activities. They also had a great arrangement with a rental car company and were able to get us a car dropped off and picked up at the hotel. The rooms were clean and fresh. They looked newly remodeled. The hot tub was great. The restaurant staff was also friendly and helpful. Beautiful setting and the location was close to many activities. We had great views from our balcony out to the harbor. We enjoyed watching the ships and boats enter and leave the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Snooze and Cruise (or fly)”
Reviews.Author: traveldan21
Reviews.Content: Booked a Snooze and Cruise rate at the hotel website. I thought it was a pretty fair deal for a double queen room, ocean view at Casa Marina building. Although we paid for only 1 night, we got to leave our car in their covered garage for a week without nightly charges. Plus, their free shuttle van took us to the airport in the morning to catch our flight out to Hawaii. (If you are doing the Snooze and Cruise/Fly thing, also check out Humphrey's Half Moon Bay Inn which is located virtually next door to the Island Palms Hotel, and appears to be a sister hotel to this one. Humphrey's also has a similar Snooze and Cruise deal, although the price likely will be a little higher.) The room itself was very nice with reasonably updated furnishings. And the view from the second floor window and balcony was beautiful, overlooking the marina and the hills of Point Loma. After checking in in the afternoon, I spent a good hour sitting on the balcony, enjoying the view and taking advantage of the free wi-fi. Couldn't be more pleasant. The location on Shelter Island is central to a lot of San Diego, but not really walking distance to anywhere. So, don't stay here unless you have a car to get around. For a stay at a reasonably priced, clean and well maintained hotel before a cruise or flight out, you can't really beat this place. As an added plus, the front desk clerk was very friendly and seemed eager to be of service. Seems hard to believe, but too many "service industry" people don't seem to like to serve. Love to patronize those who still know what service means. I can highly recommend Best Western Plus Island Palms Hotel. If you have any reservations about a Best Western, don't hesitate to try this one. Definitely the nicest property carrying the Best Western designation I've run across.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place on the bay”
Reviews.Author: Cloud_Breaker
Reviews.Content: This is an outstanding hotel. The front desk people were always very nice and gave me several great suggestions for where to go and what to see. They took care of any problems with a smile and followed up to make sure I was happy with the results. I love the location and thought this was one of the best hotels I have stayed in. It's close to the airport and only a few miles from downtown. Be sure to go and see the U.S.S. Midway. It's staffed by mostly volunteers who are vets and you would be surprised at what you can learn just walking around there.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Nattravels
Reviews.Content: The Casa Del Mar Suite was super awesome. Brand new at the time we went. I love this property. Everyone is nice. You feel like your in Hawaii with the decor and the feel of being surrounded by water. It's way better than staying at hotel circle or Downtown SD. The Island Palm side is old. Cute but old. It's near the big pool area and check in. The bike rentals are free to guests.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms, Gorgeous Location”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn810
Reviews.Content: Normally when I stay in San Diego, I stay in downtown; however, all the hotels were very expensive in downtown this time, so I chose this Best Western Plus based on price. When I arrived, I was completely surprised by the amazing location. The hotel is across a small two lane street from the beautiful marina, with a terrific view of downtown. There are benches to sit on in front of the marina. I sat there and watched the ducks, pelicans, seagulls, and boats pass by. My room was on the ground floor directly across the marina with a gated patio out front. It looked like a small vacation condo from the outside. The inside completely shocked me. Granite counter in the bathroom, a huge walk in shower made it feel spa-like. The bedroom was gorgeous with a high wooden plank ceiling, ceiling fan, and white plantation shudders. I can't wait to stay there again, it felt like I was staying at a resort in Cabo.

Reviews.Title: “Back again”
Reviews.Author: mauigirl2005
Reviews.Content: This is my third visit to the Island Palms. I've stayed in the Casa Del mar and in the Island Palms (different sections of the hotel) and I've enjoy each stay. This is a nice easy none expensive hotel and i stay her on business. It isn't luxury but its a good deal with a great view. I always travel with earplugs and last I didn't need them but this time I have a 5 yr above me, nuff said! Here are some pics from my current room. My room last time was identical to this only two doors down. I requested this part of the hotel because it has a small garden outside and overlooks the marina. I love sitting after work with a cup of tea (there is a fridge, coffee machine and microwave in the room) and kicking back. The map I've posted is the hotel floor plan. The back of the hotel overlooks the marina although both sides overlook water. I like being in the back on either the right or left sides. My favorite rooms are 145-148 149-152 162-165 in the Island Palms and the corner rooms in the Casa Del Mar. All overlook the marina in the back. Room service is pretty good although not a huge choice. The Salmon with fingerling pots and green beans is $20 plus 18% added and its good. The rooms I stay in are all Kingsize Marina View however the rooms above which have the same view are all double double I believe.

Reviews.Title: “Well located base for exploring San Diego”
Reviews.Author: PG_GB
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a real fancy place but it is clean and well located for exploring San Diego. It is only a short drive from the airport but off the flight path. Our room did not have a tub but did have a nice shower. Access to the rooms was direct without having to go down a corridor which was very convenient. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: beazfam
Reviews.Content: After a long drive through LA and a full day of Legoland we were ready to relax. As I walked through the doors and you know immediately that we will be well taken care of. The location of the hotel is perfect for being able to bounce from attraction to attraction with little traffic and easy routes. I especially liked being removed from downtown where we could go for a great morning walk along the bay. There was even a small park for the kids across the street, which the kids loved. Our two room suite was excellent. It had a small kitchen, couch and a patio facing the marina. My son (7) was in heaven with his adjoining room all to himself. As he put it, “I have a bed to watch TV, and a bed to sleep in!” The staff was incredible; everyone we passed had a great smile and warm hello. We ordered up a crib and it was delivered promptly and was quickly asked if everything was in order and if we needed anything else. The restaurant was very nice for our morning breakfasts and the kids loved it. For our last dinner my little girl was obsessed with pancakes and my wife asked if the chef would be able to make pancakes for her. She quickly came back and said that the chef would be more than happy. Our (outstanding) waitress came back with four small pancakes, fresh made whipped cream, and strawberries. She was in heaven. My wife referred to her diver scallops as the best she has ever had. This hotel was perfect for us, close to the zoo, waterfront, restaurants, pool, view, and the staff. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and outstanding front desk staff.”
Reviews.Author: Marriedcouple61
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff are excellent. Location excellent. Chef in hotel restaurant excellent. Room recently renovated needed more quality control - additional mirror outside bathroom and hair blower.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in San Diego area”
Reviews.Author: sstring
Reviews.Content: We always look forward to staying at the Island Palms Hotel. Location is quiet, beautiful and right on the bay. We run several half marathons each year in the San Diego area and stumbled upon this hotel last year. Price was right, hotel is clean and friendly, nice restaurant and bar on premises, two pools and Jacuzzi's near all rooms. Rooms are large, beds are very comfortable, and all the amenities we need. Lovely patios outside the rooms, sip a glass of wine and enjoy the sunset. Visit the bar, adjacent to the restaurant. Great appetizers and wonderful staff. Ask for Elise, one of the bartenders we met last year. She's a gem and will give you first class service. We discovered she ran the San Diego Half Marathon for the first time and beat us all - we were impressed and jealous! Have a wonderful stay, you'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in a beautiful area”
Reviews.Author: JimmyT63
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights and thoroughly enjoyed being on Shelter Island.We ate at the Blue Wave Grill the first night and everything was perfect,our server even made sure we placed our wine order in time for "Happy Hour".Our junior suite was clean and comfortable even if the"eco-fridge" was mostly too warm as you apparently have to keep re-setting it.We will stay here again and have already recommended this property to family.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: aloha4now
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in MAY 2011 (late review I know!) and it was better than I expected. My husband is a diamond elitem rewards member so we stay with this chain alot, I booked this based on the pictures on the Best Western website. When we arrived we were prompty checked in and assigned a room in the newer building, it was clean and quiet. We were impressed with the location, right accross from the marina and water on either side. We were walking the grounds one night a saw a mamma duck sitting on her babies to keep them warm, super cute! Pool was clean and there is a nice fireplace to chat by the pool. Staff was helpful when needed. Wouldn't hesistate in staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: CathyWolf
Reviews.Content: The Island Palms is a great pre-cruise hotel. We arrived and were checked in quickly and off to our rooms which were part of the park and sail package. We were with friends who had an identical room (all 4 of us were in the same car). At check-in they told us to park anywhere we wanted for the night, but then to move the car to the garage at the far end of the property, so the car was in their covered garage while we were on the cruise, this was an unexpected plus. We also visited their bar for happy hour, then the restaurant for dinner and breakfast. We had good food and drinks and all the employees were very friendly. The hotel property is nice, has a view of the marina at the back and the harbor at the front, except it is across the parking lot, road, and a park. We signed up for their shuttle to the cruise pier at check-in and were taken from in front of the lobby to the pier right on time. When we returned from the cruise, we called the office and the shuttle was busy at the moment, but showed up to pick us up within about 20 minutes. The driver was a very nice young man who was quite entertaining.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: McBab
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights and loved it. Front desk service was fantastic as was bar and restaurant. Great view of the harbor - always something interesting sailing by and remarkably quiet. Free parking and great value for the location. Marina at the back of the hotel and the harbor in the front. We loved happy hour, half price drinks and appys that were big enough for a meal. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great one night stay!”
Reviews.Author: GrizzlyCountry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a queen suite with our 3 children. As it was a corner room we could see the marina and the bay. The overall look of the room was just a bit dated, but we still enjoyed it. The kids loved the pool, and according to some locals it was very cool outside so we had it to ourselves! (We're from Canada and were not about to let a little cool keep us out of the water!) For the room we had, and the location, we were happy with the value. The only noise I heard was when a seagull woke me up! Will stay again when we are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: h2osun
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in March 2012, and loved it. The location is perfect - close to the airport, downtown, and the bay. The room (in the Marina building) was freshly renovated, and was spacious, offering two queen beds, night tables, easy chairs with a table, desk, etc. The bathroom was very clean and modern, and the patio was large enough to sit and enjoy the scenery. The dark wood shutters on the windows were attractive and provided a room darkening effect. Although we didn't use the pool or hot tub, both looked well maintained. There was also an outdoor fireplace beside the pool, which overlooks the marina. Would love to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: HolyDistance
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights there with my wife last xmas. it is very quiet on the island, the rooms are perfect, spacious and clean. parking was a little bit crowded, but you can find a spot anyway. the buildings are beautiful, you can enjoy the sunshine. and it is not far away from downtown, or the parks

Reviews.Title: “Couple - Visiting Family, Work & Play”
Reviews.Author: Sarah G
Reviews.Content: I have to say I absolutely adore this resort. I vacationed here frequently as a child in the 80s and attended college in San Diego because of my vacation experiences. I moved to Seattle four years ago and this is still my favorite place to stay when I visit. It is really is the best value out there (wait for the sales). Shelter Island really is a slice of paradise and is still nostalgic San Diego. It is centrally located but still offers the serenity and relaxation I look for on a trip. I choose this resort over Loews Coronado because of the parking, resort and internet daily fees! The Palms offers free plentiful parking, wireless internet, tennis and bike rentals. There is no daily resort fee and you have access to many waterfront activities. In addition, the food at the Blue Wave is reasonably priced. I recommend calling the resort and discussing your travel needs prior to booking online or with a 3rd party. The property has three buildings and several room options to choose from. I had booked a traditional room and was put in the Casa Del Mar. I have to say I was disappointed in the room. It would have been sufficient had I been traveling alone on business. It is very small and boutique like, my boyfriend and I were on top of each other. In addition, the fridge was located in the bathroom and we were missing our microwave. I brought my concerns to the attention of the night manager and he allowed me to upgrade to a Junior Suite (what is should have booked). I planned to work during our vacation and my spouse did not and I had family visiting one day. The Junior Suite was much more appropriate for our needs. Make sure you catch happy hour at the Brigatine (all night Mondays) and my nieces loved dinner at the Bali Hai. The adults loved the view and the family is considering it as a wedding location.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Lake in the Hills, Illinois, United States
Reviews.Title: “great relaxing location!”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl A
Reviews.Content: thank u island palms for a fabulous long weekend in san diego! i picked shelter island to have a relaxing experience which is what we got! the Blue Wave Grill and bar was delicious! the staff was very welcoming. thanks to the front desk for informing us of the bus stop right down the road from the hotel. we didnt want to drive on our vacation and for only $5 day pass u can use any bus or trolley which goes to many locations. the bus and trolleys were clean and very easy to find. just ask the front desk for an attraction map which was very helpful with which bus and trolleys to take for where u want to go! we had an amzing view from our room on the 3rd level of the casa marina buliding. we would definitely recommend best western island palms hotel and marina to others!

Reviews.Title: “A Sailor's Heaven”
Reviews.Author: DiverDaveMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Island Palms is on Shelter Island with San Diego Bay out the front door and hundreds of yachts right behind. The facility is very clean and well- maintained and the staff is quite friendly and helpful. The restaurant serves quality food at very reasonable prices. When there was an issue with a water heater in the building I was occupying, the staff did everything possible to make it right. The best part of this hotel is its location. The views of the bay and downtown, especially at night, are fantastic. There are lots of restaurants within walking distance and if you are a boater, it is pretty close to paradise.

Reviews.Title: “A week in San Diego for business and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: bienbrandy
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this hotel...right one the water and a great room to boot! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful with everything. I would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad mixture here”
Reviews.Author: RickinPVAZ
Reviews.Content: We booked this after much procastinating about which hotel to stay at for a short get away with little advance preparation. The location of the hotel is great. Being it is on Shelter Island it is a nice relaxed atmosphere with lots of walking available and water all around. The free parking and internet was what decided in our booking here. There are some good places to eat within easy, less than a mile, walking distance. The breakfast offered onsite at the Blue Wave was very reasonably priced and the food was good. It is an easy drive to get to the downtown area and there is a free shuttle for the airport. The pool and pool area is very small and the pool is not heated. Capacity for the pool was stated at 60 but it would have to be SRO. Not a lot of room for loungers either. There is an old section and a new section of the hotel. The old section has been remodeled but the walls are thin. I am hard of hearing, Viet Nam, and I could hear the people in the next two rooms urinating...UGH! Each time the shower was used, the toilet was flushed, etc, we could hear it. Not what we were really looking forward to for a short get away. The room we were given was small, just about three feet longer than a standard cruise ship cabin and even though painted a light color was dark and dreary. The bathroom was nice with a nice shower, even though there was no light in the shower itself, there was one right outside the shower door. The hosekeeping staff were very good and the room was kept very clean. There was free internet, bring your own cable. The room had a large flat screen TV, a microwave and a small refrigerator. The box spring on our bed made so much noise, creaking and groaning from just sitting down, rolling over that my wife went to a CVS and bought ear plugs. We mentioned this to the front desk, thinking that maybe the frame was busted, but nothing was done. Later we talked to Chris at the front desk and he offered to move us to another room but when we tried the other room in the old section of the hotel it was just as bad so we stayed where we were. we did look at one of the rooms in the new section of the hotel and they were nicer but we forgot to check out the beds. Thank you Chris for trying to make our stay better. There are certain rooms to avoid at all costs:111,117,122,144,157,168 our room,169, and 170. These are not good ones to stay in as there is no view and they are dark. There are Four rooms that are right across from the loading dock for the hotel and restuarant, plus along the walk way for the boat owners at the marina. This means lots of noise and foot traffic at all hours but especially very early in the morning. They are rooms: 134,135,136 and137. Overall it is a nice place but we will stay somewhere else next time we drive into San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was everything I wanted it to be!”
Reviews.Author: Jennykat3
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything I wanted it to be! First thing to know is there are actually 3 different buildings with different features on this property so call ahead to get a better feel of which building would suit your preferences. We stayed in the Casa del mar which is in the middle and has views of the marina or the bay. I had coffee on my own patio each morning facing the marina. Perfect. Everything was pleasant: the spacious room, the view, the patio, the pools, the free bike rentals, the service, and the price! The ONLY thing I can think of as a drawback for this hotel is having wheels- its not far from downtown/airport but I could see not having a car as a hardship from this location. So get a rental car already and drive to this awesome hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed with an incredible view”
Reviews.Author: AthensBoy
Reviews.Content: I'm very glad I booked the Island Palms for my week in San Diego. The staff was extremely helpful, very comfortable bed with an incredible view of the sailboats in the marina. At night we enjoyed the swimming pool and jacuzzi overlooking the harbor with a lit fireplace and 80s music. Parking was free and plentiful. The tennis courts under the parking structure were always available. Free wifi. Heavy classy wood blinds opened up to a patio with a spectacular view of the yachts day and night. They even picked up my wife from the airport when her flight was 3 hours delayed and my young child was asleep. It's a short drive, but not an airport hotel with boring atmosphere. Water pressure in bath very strong. Rooms had microwaves and refrigerators hidden under the large screen TVs. Excellent value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a gorgeous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: erikaalexa
Reviews.Content: I have to say this is the best hotel I've ever stayed at. This was my first trip to San Diego, and what a great introduction to this beautiful city. The waterfall at the entrance is very relaxing, and the hotel staff are true examples of what customer service should be. When I opened the door to the room (at the newer Casa Marina) the first words from my son's mouth was "Wow, how much did you pay for this?" He's 18, we've stayed at other hotels (including the "luxury" Millennium Biltmore in LA) that have cost more and this is the best room I've ever had. It had a nice patio, thought there's no view because a high fence with shrubbery covers the view of the marina. Next time (and yes, I will stay there whenever I go to San Diego, there's no need to look elsewhere) I hope to get a room with a balcony to enjoy the beautiful view. Right across from the hotel is the bay, and a nice long area to walk, jog or just enjoy the weather. At checkout there was a glitch with the charge to my card (I use a debit card) and I spoke with Sean (the manager) and he immediately cleared up the problem with my bank. This hotel really is first rate, the accomodations are excellent (there is construction going on and they did have a sign posted about this, but it didn't affect us at all), there is plenty of parking, and the pool and hot tub look fantastic (and I plan to use them next time I go). The Internet connection was excellent, and they even have an Ethernet port (which I didn't use but it's nice that it's there). I was very surprised, actually, at all the connections they had built in; you can bring and hdmi or component cable and connect an external device to the TV. There are also plenty of electric sockets, very useful nowadays. The beds in Casa Marina are adjustable in their firmness/softness, though I didn't notice any difference no matter what number I set it to, they were all around quite comfortable with plenty of pillows. The bathroom was also very nice and big with pleny of storage and more towels than you can ever need. The blow dryer is a very good one with a retractable cord that is NOT attached to the wall so you can use it anywhere in the room. There is also a small safe in the room, but I didn't need to use it so I can't comment on how it works. Great place to say!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect 10”
Reviews.Author: KitCadbury
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 night midweek stay in San Diego - selected this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and liking the look of Shelter Island. Ideally I prefer to book direct with hotel - but BW weren't offering anything like the discount available thro several online booking agents so I took my chances on room allocation. This hotel was as near perfection as my budget is ever going to allow in San Diego! Location 10/10 Shelter Island was an idyllic location for our purposes. With picturesque and interesting Marina on one side and far reaching Bay views on the other. So serene and peaceful. For anyone who likes to start their day with a run or a walk this place is perfect with paths pretty much right around the island, safe, pristine and precious little traffic. In addition to the water, views and boats there are plenty of other diversions - statues, fishing piers, playparks. I read somewhere their was no beach at Shelter Island - certainly compared to what else is available locally but I spotted at least two small [imported?] sandy areas. Pleasant stroll or very short drive back up to Shelter Island village for provisions or wider choice of restaurants/bars etc. - Getting there a piece of cake from the airport. Hotel offers a free shuttle but we selected to pick up our rental car first - Doh! Alamo shuttle took us right downtown - but no big deal seemed like just a five minute [evening time] drive back to Shelter Island [somewhat longer in daytime traffic]. Check In/Out 10/10 Checking in took moments. The receptionist was warm, welcoming and superbly efficient. She gave us brief clear directions re parking [free] & how to find room. I had booked a "Traditional" room which can come in one or two doubles. As we had our 12 yr old daughter with us I added a note to our booking requesting one with two beds if available but I know the score, so no expectations. Well she made no mention of upgrading us but I find it hard to believe the room we were allocated is their base rate room. Check out was similarly efficient. There were half a dozen folk ahead of me with two staff on reception and a third receptionist appeared. No nasty surprises on bill. And best of all - check out is not till midday. Enabling you to take your time and enjoy last morning on vacation. More hotels please take note guests really really appreciate this! Room: 10/10 Fabulous from the moment you enter. Smells fresh, Immaculate, spacious, really lovely contemporary decor, Generous Balcony. Attractive wooden shutters and full wall of windows overlooking marina just a few yards beyond. Microwave/Fridge/Coffee Machine/Iron etc. Plentiful and good coffee! Mugs & glasses. Appeared also to be a playsation or some sort of games controller supplied tho we didn't use. But it was the beds that really blew us away. We were just mocking the laminated "boast" sheet supplied to advise guests just how special their beds are - when we sat down on them. and almost didn't get up again to explore San Diego. Really BW no laminated sheet required. These beds scream for themselves. They even have individual bedside controls if you prefer harder or softer mattress! Bedding superb, oh so soft cotton sheets. Although all the parking spaces around our building were taken we felt as if we were only folk there - no noise from other rooms at all, save for very occasional plumbing pipe creaks that seem common to every hotel I've ever stayed in. Woken only by ducksong. If I'm nitpicking here there is only a central bedside table - so nowhere for person on outerside of beds to control their bedside light or place a glass of water etc. Nor could I find a power point near the beds. But only real issue was TV remote. They have these "superhygienic" new remotes - we couldn't get our TV to work at all the first night, would have reported this to reception but couldn't get our phone to work either. We were jetlagged so not a problem - we left a note for housekeeping and sure enough both phone and TV remote working on our return later next day.The remote was only partially working but enough to get us local San Diego channel. But on day 3 again couldn't get any response other than switch on/off. If it mattered to us I have no doubt at all this could have been sorted with a single call but we were just too busy enjoying the views, the spas and the beds. Bathroom 9/10 Immaculate, spacious, good water pressure and temperature control on the shower. Toilet flush virtually silent. Plentiful and plush towels and good in-room toiletries supplied. The half-depth bath was new to me. Are these common? I come from a land of more than our fair share of rainfall so I'm conscientious to generally avoid baths if I'm somewhere where water is scarce - but I confess curiosity got the better of me and I had to try it out. Perfectly fine though I had a wee bit of mopping up to do afterwards! Just a couple of comments - no glass or anywhere to place toothbrushes? Cmon! And a shaving/makeup mirror would be so helpful. Also noted no liners in the trashcan - thumbs up environmentally [tho can't be much fun for the maids?]. Pool/Spa 10/10 We visited during a particularly cold spell. But we are from Scotand escaping to California in February - nothing was going to keep us out of the pool. We spent some time in the attractively landscaped main area by bar restaurant which has a very generous and deep pool and spa But in fact we preferred the rather plainer small pool & spa closer to our building - due to the unobstructed marina views and good windscreen. Both pool and spa temperatures were absolutely spot on for the season. Nor did we have any skin reactions to cleaning chemicals - Highest commendations to whoever is maintaining these! We had a great time here. Would I return / recommend ? Absolutely! Significantly, as my review is doubtless colored by the discounted low season rate I paid, do I consider this hotel to be worth its full rack rate? Well throw in breakfast and yes I do.

Reviews.Title: “Quality you can rely on”
Reviews.Author: jimhoniss
Reviews.Content: Once again we stayed here as we have twice before. The location is the best. And everything looked brand new. This is the result of their continued renovations and upgrades.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: angels3jan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is reasonably price, in a wonderful location, safe with an excellent staff and made for walkers. You can't go wrong when choosing a room with a marina view or ocean view. On one stay while walking the island a Navy air craft carrier cruised by and you could almost reach out and touch it. On another occasion a Navy destroyer. You can lay in bed on the marina side and view all the magnifent sail boats and from an ocean front room watch the Navy planes taking off. Absolutely no street traffic noise and parking is free. I have stayed at this hotel twice rooms are sparkling clean bathrooms are roomy rooms are large and cheery. I can't wait to return. Thank you Sean and Chris for the personalized service.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay without fee gouging”
Reviews.Author: PatrickGe
Reviews.Content: At last in this Corporate Greed Era an attractive resort without the unethical "Resort" and "Parking" fees that reflect not only greed but also management stupidity because they kill the goose that lays golden eggs. Reasonable prices for a waterfront location and gracious service. Excellent, reasonably priced restaurant. Now the bill is inflated by taxes and fees imposed dictatorially by California and San Diego who are thus forcing the hapless visitors to help pay the deficits caused by their mismanagement. A tip: Pay the small extra cost to get a Marina View room.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Island Palms lived up to all the great reviews!”
Reviews.Author: TravelMel72
Reviews.Content: Whenever I find a great deal, I get a little concerned about what the hotel will really be like. This hotel lived up to all the reviews. We stayed in room 501 in the Casa del Mar building and it was wonderful – 2nd floor, awesome views of the ocean and San Diego skyline, clean room, comfortable bed, free wi-fi, free parking and no noise issues. The breakfast room service was reasonable, the food was good and it came right on time. The property was well maintained and the staff were friendly and helpful. The room came with a refrigerator and we had a microwave delivered (no charge). I enjoyed the complimentary bike rentals, perfect to ride around Shelter Island. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value; Location”
Reviews.Author: Kevin A
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic!!! Convenient location, friendly staff, great view across the bay! We stayed here a couple of years ago and our first experience brought us back again. This time was just as nice. The next time we are in San Diego you will find us at the Island Palms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Overall”
Reviews.Author: smmcisaa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of our California vacation. I thought the location was great, beautiful area, close enough to all attractions and amenities but still feel like you are far far away from the hustle of the city. We loved our room, free parking, LOVED the pool and hot tub and check in and out was very quick. Our only complaint was on a second last day, maintenance came in our room while we were out which we didn't know about and they switched all the light switched to sensors and after that, we couldn't keep our bathroom light on no matter what we did. After 10 seconds, it would go out, even if you manually turned the light on. It was super annoying but since we had one night left, we said nothing and mentioned it at check out with not much in the way of a response other than they had several issues.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Waterfront Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BruceWyder
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Island Palms prior to a cruise. The hotel is older, but well maintained, it is quite well located for local restaurants and also day trips. The landscaping is well done and the Food and Beverage are very good. The pool is interesting because of its shape and hot tub is not too hot. The staff are very nice and we will stay there again when in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay but some reservations”
Reviews.Author: albertst
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Casa Marina building on the 2nd floor for three nights with a fantastic view of the marina, just wonderful, it has a Hawaiian feel. Pros: The room was fresh and well furnished, comfy bed and pillows, good coffee machine. Housekeeping was meticulous, reception staff were friendly and helpful, lovely breakfast with charming staff at the restaurant, good fitness centre, perfect location to go for a run in the morning. Good parking. Cons: We ended up buying earplugs because of an invasive hum all night, we did not need to use our airconditioner, the fridge had some noise, but this noise sounded like a compressor. The TV reverted to closed captioning at each start up, we had maintenance up to sort it out but it continued! It took several steps to get to get to regular TV stations, scrolling through pay movie channels etc. Bathroom seemed to lack any ventilation. Having said all of this it is a great place to stay, the pros outweigh the cons :-)

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Home Base for San Diego Adventures”
Reviews.Author: wanderingoutoftowner
Reviews.Content: I booked this car/hotel package on Hotwire, so I can't really comment on the hotel's rates, but overall, since it was during the off-season, prices seemed much more reasonable. Upon arrival, I found out that we had been assigned to a ground floor unit a few steps away from the main lobby. I'm pretty bad with spatial intelligence, so it took the front desk receptionist several attempts to explain the hotel's layout to me. Apparently, all the rooms were in adjacent 2-story structures to the check-in area, separate "condo-like" units that are completely self-contained (i.e., there is no common hallway). I found it interesting that the units had a small, gated patio in front (see photos). Although I didn't use it myself, my neighbors spent a good deal of time outside smoking and discussing their exploits. The interior of the room itself was as expected--bed, TV, and bathroom. There was no tub (if that's what you are looking for), but the overall floor plan was sufficient for two people (maybe three). An air conditioning unit was available, but I opted to turn on the ceiling fan instead to circulate the air. There was also an in-room safe you could store stuff in by entering your own 4-digit code. I felt that the room was clean and comfortable. A microwave and mini-fridge were also available. The only issue I had was with the noise that would occasionally seep in from next door. I don't know if this was because my neighbors were unusually rowdy, their sleeping patterns diverged significantly from mine, or if the walls were flimsy, but late in the evening, and even up to 3 in the morning or thereabouts, I would hear banging sounds and laughter from time to time. When they were sitting outside in their patio area, I could hear chunks of the conversation, so perhaps they were practicing oration. Whatever the case, this was only a minor irritant. Passing traffic is barely audible, but you may hear the sounds of passersby on the way back to their rooms. The hotel itself is located on a strip of land (can't tell if it is a natural or man-made peninsula) that is accessible via the main stretch of road called Shelter Island Drive. As a result, the location is somewhat out of the way if you are looking to be in the city proper itself, but I actually enjoyed having free parking (abundant) and relative peacefulness after a full day's worth of activities. That being said, you will NOT be stranded in the middle of nowhere--everything is a reasonable drive away. Directly in front of the unit is a stretch of park where I encountered many joggers and other vacationers. You can also see the airport from that vantage point (approx. 10 min. drive). Behind the unit is a marina. There are a LOT of boats moored here (see photo). I think I've covered pretty much everything. Bottom line: if you don't mind straying a little from the city, what you have here is a nice place to recoup from your adventures and plot your next course of action. Of course, this all assumes you will be renting a car because taking a taxi from here would get ridiculously expensive really quickly. Hope this helps with your decision. Happy trails!

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: Lighthouse21
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night were told upon check in we were complimentary upgraded to a suite. The room may have been bigger but the view was awful. We were n the first floor on a corner and when you sat on the patio all you saw were bushes and the building next door. No marina view unless you stood up. Then we check out and they are charging me for this "complimentary" upgrade. I was able to get the charge removed but check your receipts I feel like they are trying to scam you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Tillsonburg
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying in San Diego and really enjoyed the marina view- but the view from the ocean side would have been great too. Very clean and well- maintained rooms. The bed was very comfortable .Nice balcony. Danny at front desk was very helpful as were the others. Being on Shelter Island was quieter(except for the helicopters across the harbour)and it didn't feel like you were in a huge city even tho' you were so close to most things. We enjoyed going to Point Loma and the Cabrillo monument area-- and were happy to spot some whales in the distance plus a beautiful red tail hawk soaring in front of us at the cliff. The trolley tour picked us up at the hotel and that was a great way of getting an overall look at the city -- the trolley drivers/ guides were great! WE drove to the zoo and enjoyed the Balboa park. Lots of great restaurants-- especially liked the ones close by the hotel-- Bali Hai-- amazing food and decor and Humphreys was excellent. The Blue wave restaurant at the hotel was ok but not as high end food. San Diego is a great city

Reviews.Title: “BREATHTAKING BEAUTIFUL HOTEL AND VIEWS”
Reviews.Author: dringot
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great, try to get a room on the 3rd floor on the marina side,. its beathtaking every morning when you wake up. Danny at he front desk is a gem of an employee and very accomdating. Probably would no go back to zoo,once is enough will not go back to Scripps aquarium, not worth the money. The hotel is very convenient to Seaport Village, Zoo, La Jolla,the Gaslight District and the aiport. If you go to Seaport Village don"t take a bike ride by the Naval ships or go to Joe"s to eat. The Bike rider quoted us one price and the upped it on us after we had gone on and went a ways.He had long hippie hair and told inapprroppriate jokes. Will not stay any place else.,the service at the resturant and front desk was wonderful and the food was great at the hotel, stay here and you will not be disappointed. The bike rider must have something going with Joe"s eatery at Seaport Village because he only wanted us to go there and the food was awful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Retreat In The Middle of a City!”
Reviews.Author: Wxtraveler
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to San Diego and I found Shelter Island to be a nice quiet retreat in the middle of a major city. It felt like being on a little island out in the ocean. The park across from the hotel has some very nice views of the San Diego skyline and if you book a room with a water view (costs a little extra but it is worth it) you can enjoy this view from your room. The location is nice in that you can get to the airport, downtown San Diego and Cabrillo National Monument within 10-15 minutes. I stayed in the Casa Marina Building. The room was nicely sized and furnished with a refrigerator. The bathroom was a nice size as well. Everything was very clean. The only drawbacks to this property (and they are minor) is that if you do stay in the Casa Marina building it is a bit of a walk to the main building/lobby. Also, the on site restaurant is located there. There is a grocery store a short distance away so you could always get away with bringing some food back and eating in your room for breakfast. If I ever came back to San Diego I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tringot
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Island Palms is a beautiful hotel that is centrally located--minutes away from downtown, the Gaslamp District, La Jolla, the airport and many other destinations. The rooms were very clean and the view from the 3rd floor marina rooms was fantastic! Danny at the front desk was so helpful and upgraded our room. Everyone we dealt with from the hotel was fantastic and the food at the restaurant was very good. We will stay here every time we go to San Diego!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Bernadette V
Reviews.Content: Great location right by the marina, and across from the bay! Great staff! Comfortable room, and easy to get into town from the island!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful spot and excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Loriette
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights during a road trip down Hw1 in December 2011 and wish we'd had more time there. The hotel staff are so helpful. We arrived late and were asked if it was ok to upgrade us to a first floor suite! (Would anyone ever say no to that?!). Breakfast delicious. We had a waitress called Robin who was simply charming to us 'English folk'. Views over both the marina and bay fantastic, and this was a nice safe area to walk around. Would love to come back one day. The best BW+ we have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: VegasC
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice in the last 2 years, with the most recent being over the Christmas holidays 2011. It can be pricey, so keep watching the rates, they fluctuate all the time, we got a rate of $95 per night which is the cheapest I've seen. The staff are always friendly and there to help... upon check in, I found out our room wasn't ready (we checked in at 11am, check in isn't until 3).. but the girl at the counter found us a room in a different building as long as we were ok with that. This time we stayed in the island palms building, adjacent to the front desk building. It was small but nice and basic.. had a flat screen tv, pillow top bed and a nice view of the bay. The bathrooms were recently rennovated, had a granitie stand up shower and vanity. Last time we stayed, we were in the Casa Marina building which is under going rennovations now as well. One of their pools were closed on this visit for the same reason. I don't like facing the marina, you can hear the boats at 6 am if they blow their horns, otherwise it's nice and peaceful. It's a short drive to all the attractions, including the zoo, seaworld, outlet mall, and anywhere else you might want to go. They also have boat tours in the area that take you to whale watch. All in all, another good visit and they met our needs. Housekeeping didn't come pick up our room service trays right away and some seagulls rummaged through it, leaving a big mess on the sidewalk and taking off with a napkin but when I called room service, they came right away. Seems like it's a common problem lol. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Accommodation...”
Reviews.Author: The_Alloways
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the first hotel on our whirlwind stop and such as pleasant suprise, the hotel was an oasis and just the place to return to each day, the rooms were spacious and well appointed. The staff offered us the choice of two rooms one overlooking the marina and the other overlooking the bay, the bay was our final choice after looking at both as the view at night and first thing in the morning was very cool. The staff were all firendly and very helpful including helping to find one of the best burgers in town. If I had a complaint it would have to be the room service tray still left in the halls after a day.

Reviews.Title: “Quick One night Stopover”
Reviews.Author: rileymacdonald
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I drove from Las Vegas. I used points to stay at the hotel so it did not cost me a thing. I think if I would have had to pay more than $100 for a night I would be upset. We arrive at about 7 at ngiht. Checked in. We stayed in room 100 or 101. the room was clean but it was a little odd. It looked like some next or something was in the high celing. Our room was right out on the road. There was nothing exeptional abut the room. The washroom was very nice. The walls are paper thin. After we checked in we left and went downtown for dinner. We got bacck at about 11 and crashed. We were woken up at 6 the next morning by our neighbors. I swear, they must have had 6 kids in there and a bunch of Aunts. We heard EVERYTHING. I banged on the wall once and that seemed to quiet them down. I knew everything that was being said. We went for breakfast at the restaurant. The food was fine. The views were really pretty and the waiters were friendly. When I checked out we asked the front desk for directions and they were very helpfull. We checked out and went to stay downtown at the W.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Island Palms Hotel and Marina”
Reviews.Author: jp2005
Reviews.Content: We were given a room on the first floor in the end building. We asked for a higher floor and the front desk clerk, Ajia, was very accommodating and helpful. She offered us a room on the top (3rd) floor. She also showed us a jr. suite and a full suite (extra cost for both), but we opted for the third floor room, which turned out to be a good decision. The room wasn't ready so we had dinner in the hotel's restaurant while we waited for the room to be cleaned. 90 minutes later - not ready yet. Ajia apologized and offered to buy us a drink in the bar while we waited a few more minutes. Room cleaned - checked in - great view of the marina. Definitely request a higher floor if you go. Otherwise, morning walkers and dogs doing their morning "business" will greet you as you awake and look out your patio windows. Some of those boat dwellers certainly need to learn how to carry plastic bags and pick up their dog's droppings. I suggest the hotel should complain to the marina management about this. We saw a few dogs being allowed to pee on the sidewalk (watch the wet trails, morning walkers) and another very lazy couple with a big black great dane and a smaller white dog just kick rocks over their dog's feces pile. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. They have adjustable mattresses so each side can be adjusted to each sleeper's desired firmness. The bright nightlight on the clock radio may be disturbing and unplugging it means you won't have an alarm clock. A folded towel laid over the light did the trick. Maybe there is a way to turn it off, but I didn't see it. The in room coffee maker is nice, but it would be nicer if there were some "to go" coffee cups so guests can take a cup along. Or, free coffee in the lobby would be a nice touch. Wifi was adequate and free. There is a free to use PC in the lobby also. The day shift front desk staff are also all very helpful and Danny was especially so. So, do request a floor other than first floor and be sure to ask for a room facing the marina if you want that view.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Airport”
Reviews.Author: Pauly023
Reviews.Content: Terrific and convenient hotel....near airport and provides a taste of the tropics minutes away. Rooms are OK...but if it is all about convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Excellent”
Reviews.Author: lakemissy
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel several times and have always been happy with it. The staff is very polite, efficient and pleasant. The rooms are clean and quiet. The property is pretty in a gorgeous setting.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Marina aspect. Average facility”
Reviews.Author: suspend6
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated on Shelter Island (which is not really an island). It is a few miles from the airport, and a bit further to downtown. We only had breakfast there during our two-day stay, which was very good. We had a room that overlooked the marina, which was very pleasant. The room was a little tired, but acceptable. The tourist trolley picks up right at the front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately, the bed was terrible”
Reviews.Author: kdlh
Reviews.Content: This hotel would have probably gotten the top review from us if it weren't for the hard as a brick beds. Pros: The setting is great. Roms are spacious and well appointed with nice decor. Fairly clean and well stocked. Pretty quiet - you can hear normal hallway noise and when someone is loud outside. The fog horn and seagulls. I am a stickler about the bathroom. We are a tall family and appreciate when the shower head is not hitting me in the belly button - thumbs up there. Cons: Back to the bathroom. The towel rack that was mounted to the inside of the shower wall fell off into the tub. Luckily no one was in the tub at the time. And the handle to turn on the water came off in our hand. (The staff was informed of the needed repairs on our departure) Then there is the fancy bed. You suppsedly can adjust the firmness with a knob on the side of the mattress. Either ours were broken or they don't work properly, because no matter what way we turned the dial, the mattresses were hard as rocks. Not a very good night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great three-day getaway at Island Palms”
Reviews.Author: kellyclayt
Reviews.Content: We spent three days at the Island Palms on Shelter Island in San Diego. Shelter Island is a great location that is very near downtown and yet "away" enough to make it very relaxing and quiet. There are great views of the city and the marina. The hotel has free bikes available to use and ride around the small island which was fun. There are also two very nice pool & jacuzzi areas which we enjoyed. We ate at the onsite bar during happy hour twice and it was great - good happy hour food specials and very friendly bar employees. We also ordered food of the restaurant menu which was very good. One afternoon we went down the road to the Bali Hai for fabulous Mai Tais and happy hour snacks. The room was beautiful, new, spacious, and very comfortable. We were in the Casa Marina building which is the newest one and had a lovely balcony on the third floor overlooking the marina. We enjoyed the very comfy beds, large flat-screen tv, free internet, coffee maker, small microwave, and small refrigerator. The bathroom was very large and the bath products supplied were very nice. The only downside was that the large heavy doors to the interior hallway made a very loud noise when slammed closed and one of the nights we had neighbors who did this frequently, but this seems to be a problem at a few other hotels at which we have stayed as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place with a Beautiful View!”
Reviews.Author: Matthew D
Reviews.Content: I was there back in September and I loved it! Chris Botti was playing at Humphries and we could hear it perfectly from right outside our room facing the marina and the hills behind it. Make SURE you go for the slightly higher cost of having a room that faces the Marina! Best $20 bucks I ever spent. Next time I am in San Diego I'll be sure to return!

Reviews.Title: “What a View & Hotel!! LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: Wayneo56
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week here and couldn’t have been happier. What a beautiful hotel/Marina/view/property!! Having never been to San Diego or even California before, I wasn’t really sure what to expect or what the hotel area was going to be like. We were so pleasantly surprised to see that we got it right. The hotel/property is within a marina on Shelter Island. This island oasis is 5 - 10 minutes from the airport/Gaslight district/downtown/Balboa park/Zoo/Seaworld/Little Italy/shopping/and everything else that you want to see/do in San Diego, but it is like being somewhere in the Caribbean as it just has that “Island” feel to it, (there is even a Hawaiian restaurant nearby with EXCELLENT Mai Tais and luaus). The rooms are very nice/tastefully decorated and Comfortable!! The Beds and Pillows are sooo plush & luxurious (we checked the tags so that we could get the same ones for ourselves at home)!! There are 2 heated pools, one has a restaurant attached, the other has an outdoor fireplace that we spent quite a few nights at swimming/talking/drinking & star gazing. The sunset views from here were also Amazing!! The staff were all very helpful & accommodating to us. We would stop off in the morning on our way to various activities and they always had a discount coupon & direct ions for us. Free Wi-Fi (even in our room), Free bike rentals to explore the island, rooms are cleaned daily and so much more!! Great value for your money!! We can’t wait to come back to San Diego & the Island Palms Best Western!!! If you haven’t been to San Diego, start planning now!! There is so much to do and it is reasonable. I wanted to go to Atlantis, but with the cost for 4 days there, I was able to do No-stop airfare from NJ/Hotel/car rental/meals and all of our activities for 8 days!! We were also able to keep our hard earned Vacation dollars here in the US where it is needed to support our economy. :o) Must sees: The San Diego Zoo, La Jolla & Children's Beach, The Corvette Diner (Especially if you have kids).

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: aliwithattitude
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 7 nights and had a really wonderfull time. The room was brand new and even though there was construction going on in the corridor next to us you would never have known. The views are amazing and the fire place by the pool makes a faniastic place to watch the sun go down. I went over to the main bar to sit and watch the boats and read my book -- decided to have one drink and sit out on the deck -- four drinks later -- No reading was done but I had made some new friends.. It was a fun way to pass and afternoon. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpfull and could have not helped more..

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: yjason1
Reviews.Content: A good hotel for a week in san diego. The location is convenience. The rooms are not particularly comfortable or luxurious but it offers a good value for money option and they are very clean . The sheets smelled fresh and they were very quick to fix our air conditioning when it was noisy. I think breakfast was also of good variety and good enough quality although the eggds were undercooked on 2 occasions.

Reviews.Title: “A+++ Value, Service, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Patrick A
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent stay at the property in November. The staff were exceptional: friendly and accommodating at the front desk. At one point we could not locate a missing toothbrush and asked the front desk if there were any. Within 2 minutes a fresh tooth brush arrived. Big TV, lots of channels, plenty of room. Beautiful area, be sure to take advantage of the Jacuzzi and pool. Best of all it's centrally located (a few minutes from the beach, a few minutes from downtown) but still out of the way in the marina. This Best Western Plus lives up to the Plus! Actually, I think the whole line of BW Plus properties have a lot of hidden value. Plenty of gems to be found.

Reviews.Title: “We will return”
Reviews.Author: cruisin39
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel and we will return. The bedding is so comfortable, staff is amazing and a wonderful place to relax, swim, walk and enjoy the hot tub. We stayed in the Casa Del Mar building and our room opened to the pool area. We really enjoyed the fireplace at night as well as the hot tub. The room was very clean and always enough coffee for the morning. We had a room with a kitchen which was so nice. Once again, the hotel staff was amazing. We highly recommend The Island Palms.

Reviews.Title: “Great to feel welcomed”
Reviews.Author: Jette108
Reviews.Content: Ít was so nice to be welcomed after a long road trip. The room was ready - very nice and great location. Service at the reception was great - we didn't have to worry about anything, we talked about our wishes and they fulfilled them :)

Reviews.Title: “The Best in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: seniors970
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. We have stayed downtown before but never again. We will return here. The staff are very friendly and helpful, our room with patio was excellent and loved the walk along the harbor. Nice quiet village.

Reviews.Title: “Waited for a sale.”
Reviews.Author: kik23
Reviews.Content: This is our third time staying at this hotel. One of the reasons we chose it this time was because of a sale that was going on. Another reason is because, right across the street there is a pier and one of the days was a pre planned day for fishing. (no fishing license required while fishing on the pier) The location is also what keeps us coming back. The area is just beautiful with water ways on both side of the hotel. A small park across the street for the kids. Most of the San Diego tourist attractions are close. We had a suite with a full kitchen. (unexpected) The view and smell of the fresh ocean air every morning made it hard to come back home. The only negative thing I would say about the resort is that the fitness center needs to be bigger and have more weights. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Vashon4family
Reviews.Content: If you want to get out of the hussle of SD, and stay in a place right on the marina, and across the street from a park, this is perfect. The hotel is only a 5 muniute drive to SD, so totally & easily accessible. The pool is outside overloking the marina. It is really quiet and well appointed too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Tuba88
Reviews.Content: Great for the price and location! Quiet place away from the hustle and bustle, yet close enough to get to anywhere when needed. Bathrooms a little outdated. Stayed in the place down the road which was "cheaper" however they charged for parking and this place does not and is nicer. The restaraunt was excellent, great service and good food. Will stay here again. Had 2 pools and 2 hot tubs at different locations so you didn't have to walk too far to relax.

Reviews.Title: “California dreaming”
Reviews.Author: gigidygigidygoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights at the start of our SoCal road trip November 2011. After a long flight from London we arrived at the airport and were not able to use our mobile phones. The airport "ground transportation" person called the hotel for us and booked the complimentary airport shuttle. We waited a few minutes and hopped on the mini bus. The friendly driver filled us in about the area during the journey and when we got to the hotel about 10 mins later we received a free room upgrade as it was a birthday trip. The staff were lovely and friendly. Our room overlooked the bay and Naval base and we saw numerous helicopters and fighter jets taking off. We had a car during our stay - not sure how you would get on without one as the hotel is out of the way a little. Highly recommend this hotel! Breakfast is nice too !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wendybatch
Reviews.Content: Had booked to stay at this amazing hotel for 5 nights last week but ended up staying another 2 nights we liked it that much! We had a one bedroom suite overlooking the marina at the back of the hotel. It was very comfortable and well equipped with a full kitchen and large bathroom with tub and separate shower cubicle. Our view of the marina and the thousands of boats was fabulous although the weather was not really up to sitting on the balcony! From check in to check out the staff were all first rate. Especially the bar staff who worked really hard to keep everyone happy. The happy hour menu was exceptional value and despite not really being a bar person I spent an hour or so there every night - as did many others - it was a great atmosphere and seems to be used by both locals and vacationers. The food in the restaurant is also very good and we ate there three times. We used the free bikes to cycle around the marina one morning and had great fun. Also used the laundry facilities which were cheap and fast - perfect to do your laundry whilst having a drink upstairs! The area is great and we walked to several other hotel restaurants at night and also went into the fantastic Humphreys live venue a couple of times. You do need a car as other attractions and also downtown are some distance away but it is a nice area to stroll around too and the views are to die for. The only possible thing I would mark this hotel down for is the breakfast. I booked their bed an breakfast rate which was an additional $20 dollars thinking this would be good value. However, it only includes a limited choice of hot dish and no beverage. As all the breakfast dishes are less than $10 each this does not represent value for money. I have never stayed anywhere where you have to pay extra for drinks on a bed and breakfast rate. The food was good though. Despite this I would have to give this hotel 5 stars as they really do go the extra mile to keep guests happy and I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: Steve R
Reviews.Content: I booked the Island Palms while visiting the San Diego Convention Centre on business. The hotel is beautifully situated on Shelter Island with views to both sides, overlooking a marina to the North and San Diego bay to the South. It's only a 10 minute drive to the Convention Centre. The hotel itself is lovely, low rise accomodation with very nice and very large rooms with all mod cons and a huge TV screen. The food in the restaurant is excellent and I ate breakfast there every day, which i don't normally do in the States as it was so good and value for money. There are two pools, so for a chilling out sort of place between work sessions, with a swim inbetween the hotel was excellent. What made the trip memorable (?), regrettably for all the wrong reasons, was on my penultimate day when I had the misfortune to fall out of the shower, slipping on the bath mat. I gashed my head quite seriously and there was a lot of blood. On ringing reception, Bill the hotel manager appeared very quickly and was able to tell me that it would require some stitches. He kindly drove me to a nearby medical facility, waited for not an inconsiderable amount of time and then drove me back to the hotel, after I had been stitched up by a doctor. Much to my surprise the hotel had also picked up the medical bill! I can't speak highly enough about the management and staff of the Island Palms, they were professional and friendly and calm in an emergency. i wouldn't hesitate to give the hotel maximum scores and look forward to staying there again at some stage, though without the need to seek medical attention next time!

Reviews.Title: “One of our best ever hotel experiences”
Reviews.Author: Crusader63_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location for 3 nights in early Novemebr 2011 when we were meeting up with friends from California and around the world, from the moment we arrived we were greeted well and given a first class treatment from all the staff at the hotel. The rooms were clean, spacious and very comfortable. The hotels facilites were tip top and always clean especially the pool, jacuzzi and liesure areas, there was never any garbage left around, glasses were collected regulay and there was always plenty of fresh towels to use after usiung the hotels pools. The lobby of this hotel is great with a wonderful fountain feature and fitness room. Finally the food from the restuarant was superb, we had not originally intended to use the restuarant but after a fantastic steak dinner with great hor doervs on our first night, we went back and back for breakfasts, meals and evening drinks. I would highly recomend this hotel to any future guests, we thank the staff and management for making our stay so special. PS and I almost forgot what fantastic views of the harbours the city, the bay and all in such a safe enviroment, thanks Island Palms we had a great stay and will be back !

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING SAYS IT ALL!”
Reviews.Author: Raider G
Reviews.Content: I brought a group of visitors here for a sporting event and found the stay "outstanding". From the guest services to the food this is truly a fantastic place to stay. Quiet, clean and the location lends to a perfect place to see all that is San Diego. The director of guest services ( Bill Orman) was "always" there and available, making us feel special as I am sure he makes every guest feel. I will be coming back to this special place again as I believe it shows The charm and beauty of San Diego. Thank you again for your service....We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and perfect experience”
Reviews.Author: Adam H
Reviews.Content: Had a 3 night stay with a friend of mine whilst we were in town for the football. We went for a Junior Suite and were very impressed with the size and cleanliness of the rooms. We had a view of San Diego bay from the room, although the view from the other side of the hotel (over the Marina) was just as impressive. The room, including bathroom, was extremely spacious. The staff were very friendly, whether at check in, breakfast or dinner. There are a couple of swimming pools and spa/jacuzzi's and there were plenty of loungers available to cater for all guests. There was a small gym on site and whilst it did only have a few pieces of weight training equipment, one treadmill and one cross trainer, it was still sufficient to have a good morning workout. Very rarely have I stayed at hotels, both on business or leisure, where I can honestly say that the stay was pretty much perfect, but I can here. After San Diego, we went to Miami (for more football !) and it's fair to say that with the hotel experience there, I wish we'd have stayed in San Diego !! A first class resort and will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego”
Reviews.Author: JimGoHabsGo
Reviews.Content: Great Morning breakfast included, buffet style and great pllo. Near lots

Reviews.Title: “Greatness all around: rooms, service, food, location”
Reviews.Author: LisaD10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is probably San Diego's best kept secret. Location is just perfect, very beautiful, serene. Great views from everywhere. Since its only 2 stories and spread out you feel like you are at a fine resort. Furnishings very soothing, rich. Large slatted plantation shutters instead of curtains. Duvets instead of bedspreads.
