Comfortable beds. The restaurant could be a 4-star. Food is fabulous. While we were there they had a $3 special on entire selection of local beers. Staff extremely friendly and efficient. The hotel is immaculate. Will definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: travelholicaussie
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family of 4 for 3 nights in September 2011. We were out sightseeing all day so didn't make much use of the hotel pool/marina area but they were lovely. Rooms were huge, very clean and lovely views. You will definitely need a car staying here though as it is a little bit away from the other areas of San Diego (Coronado, Gaslamp District etc) Breakfast staff in the restaurant seemed to be very bored or didn't want to be there, it took 25mins one morning for fruit salad, other than that its a great quiet place to stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “I will go back.”
Reviews.Author: ScarlettHoney
Reviews.Content: Very clean and pleasant stay. The fridge was tiny, but, we made it ok. The beds were incredible. I'm looking to buy one for my home. I could sleep thru the night! I'll be back, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous find!”
Reviews.Author: tjam99
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 (2 adults, a 5&7yr old) thoroughly enjoyed this hotel! The location is beautiful with nice views from both sides of the hotel (the marina on one side and the ocean on the other). The rooms were a bit dated, but clean and HUGE!! There was a kitchen area with a fridge, microwave, kitchen table and chairs, tonnes of space in the bedroom area, and a nice bathroom area. The room also had a nice balcony with some chairs on it so we could sit and watch the boats go by. After spending a few days in Anaheim where we were nickel-and-dimed to the max, it was such a relief to get free internet and free parking at this hotel (exactly how it should be!). The front desk staff was extremely helpful and nice. The outdoor pool is heated to 83 degrees and the hottub to 103, and we used both. This hotel is not luxurious, and it is spread out over 2 or 3 buildings in a 2-story motel style. That being said, the price was fair and we felt we got great value for our money here. There is a certain character at this hotel, being right on the marina on a little island, and the neighbourhood seemed very safe and pleasant. There's a kids playground across the street and just down a bit. Just a note that this hotel is within easy driving distance to all of the San Diego attractions, but you will certainly need a car. I didn't see any shuttle service to any of them and none of them are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for boaters or vacationers!”
Reviews.Author: TravelFan2424
Reviews.Content: Our room was in the newer Casa Marina Building. Clean, comfortable rooms with tasteful decor and a balcony with beautiful views overlooking the marina. By far the nicest Best Western I've ever stayed in---the Best Western "Plus" designation seems fitting. Recently renovated pool and whirlpool area near the water and overlooking the marina was nice, too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and a great base to explore from”
Reviews.Author: DomT
Reviews.Content: I went to San Diego for a busines trip and booked this hotel so that my wife could be near the sea and chill out for a few days or jump in a cab and go downtown if she wanted. The hotel was a good choice. We were given a room in the newest wing of the hotel towrds the car park with a sea facing balcony. The rooms were spacious and had two of the biggest most comfortable beds I have slept in. The room also had a massive 50 inch HD plasma TV with plenty of channels on there to help you through the jet lag. The location is good and as its towards the end of shelter island, its quite relaxing and quiet. There were plenty of spaces to park the car, which is a bonus. The hotel wasn't too far away from the airport or downtown and although I was attending a course right across town, it was onlt a 15 minute drive. The hotel cleaning and maintainence staff were really polite and good at their jobs, but some of the girls on reception could have been more welcoming and helpful. I would definetly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: imaeztraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Casa del Mar building with nice view of marina [3rd floor]. Comfortable King bed, bath, and sitting area. Only complaints: [1] to access room, either take stairs to 3rd floor or wait for single elevator [which is used as service elevator also]; [2] only ice machine is on 2nd floor of building with NO vending machine available; need to go to nearby buildings or pool areas to find a vending machine, [3] Casa del Mar building is farthest building from lobby and its a good 3-4 minute walk from room to lobby, [4] Proximity of Shelter Island to attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and oh so comfortable! Great and not so good experience.”
Reviews.Author: lovetosightsee44588
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 week nights on the 3rd floor marina side of the Casa Marina. It was very quiet and peaceful. It was very clean, beds were most adjustable and very comfortable, linens/towels etc. were fresh and clean, plenty of room, large TV, refrigerator, safe. Everything was great from check in to check out for our first stay. VIew of the marina is pretty but will do the bay side next time to watch the ships and the city lights. Loved our stay and that is why I'm giving the excellent rating. However, we also stayed the last night of our vacation on Saturday October 22nd in another building (Island Palms) on the ground level, marina view that was less than good. This building is older, dated, and smaller. The hotel was full and a wedding was going on so lots of people. It was very loud all night long. The room above us partied all night long. Loud stomping, chairs sliding across the floor, slamming of doors, stomping on the wooden stairs next to our room up and down and then luggage sliding very loudly across the pebble walkways. The linens etc. were very nice as before however these beds were very uncomfortable and loud with even a slight move or turn. Only a loud, old window air conditioning unit. We did call the front desk and they said they would send security. The noise stopped for a short while when everyone exited the room but then they returned and it kept up all night. It ruined our last night that could have been so peaceful and quiet as before with a very nice view. Be sure to stay on the upper level and away from the wooden stairs!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel (but where was security, ie: the "noise police?")”
Reviews.Author: Franceisfine
Reviews.Content: We would really love to rate this hotel 5 stars, but unfortunately our 7th and final night changed our minds. We stayed in a queen suite which was perfect for 4 of us. We loved the little kitchen for breakfasts and snacks. The suite is nicely updated, spacious, airy and very clean. Beds were super comfy. We preferred the bay view as opposed to the marina view. The parking lot and street out front were very quiet at night. We enjoyed watching the boats and had a view of downtown San Diego. Our kitchen window had a small view of the marina too. The pools were both beautiful and warm. We didn't eat at the restaurant so can't comment. We were able to use the computer and printer in the lobby for boarding passes. Reception was efficient, helpful and friendly. Shelter Island makes for a great location for touring San Diego and has a beautiful walking path too. It was all good until our final night when a group of young people decided to party very loudly throughout the entire night in the suite beside ours. They started at 10:30 and did not stop until 6:00 a.m.!! The toilet flushed (very noisily) no less than 40 times throughout the night, bar stools screeched across the floor, doors slammed, footsteps of 10 or 12 partiers pounded up and down the outside steps right by our window and extremely loud voices carried on all night long inside and out. Where was the security in a big hotel like this?? We finally called the front desk at 2:40 a.m. and they sent someone over to check it out. However this was just a temporary solution. A few of the partiers left (with drinks in hand), but returned at 4:30 even louder. Again.. no security. Finally their lights went out at 6:00 a.m. and we slept a whole hour! Where was security all this time? And how could they not have noticed all the noise and commotion much earlier?? A quick walk around the parking lot and rooms on a regular basis is all that is required. We have been to numerous hotels and resorts in Mexico and Hawaii and situations like this would never happen. Security is constantly cruising the parking lots and guest room areas to ensure all is quiet. We are very disappointed that this was not the case at BW Island Palms. As a result, our vacation ended on a sour note and we flew home tired. BW Island Palms has lots of room for improvement in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay At Island Palms”
Reviews.Author: Rayachit
Reviews.Content: The wife and I have stayed here before and we just stayed once again for four nights at the Casa Marina building facing the marina and our stay was great. Easy check-in with very friendly front desk people. The room was very clean. I work at Caesars Palace in Las Vegas and this hotel has rooms comparitable to Caesars.Large flat screen T.V. Nice comfortable bed with lots of soft pillows. Very quite at night . I would highly recommend staying here at the Island Palms. Also free parking. Any questions about this hotel e-mail me at RCHIT49811@aol.com

Reviews.Title: “Best BW sofar, resort-like setting, quiet&tropical”
Reviews.Author: usuallyhappytravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night, late arrival, still very friendly reception at checkin. The room was very clean, bedding excellent, bright lighting and sun in the morning, that could be blocked with planatation shutters. Large flat-screen TV, good wireless internet. Room was facing the parking lot, the other side is directly next to a marina. Nearest grocery store was a Von's and Trader Joe's (about 10min drive). This hotel is close to the SAN airport, yet in the other direction of downtown, and not in the flight path. The only brief airplane noise was in the morning at about 9am from the military base across the water. The area is popular with morning joggers, very peaceful. Definitely recommended, will stop at grocery storeon the way next time to stock the fridge. Only slight downside is no breakfast included in the rate. Oh, there's also a very nice pool with hot tub overlooking the marina.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Claire G
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of September while on our honeymoon. We stayed in the Casa del Mar building in a standard King room with marina view. The room was nice, clean and had a great view over the marina. The staff were so friendly and welcoming. The breakfasts were lovely as was the bar food. Nice relaxed atmosphere. Great location for sight seeing too, everything was only ablout 10 minutes drive away. The only down side was having to get a taxi into town cost $20 each way as there isn't much nightlife near by. Overall we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, beautiful location, beautiful city!”
Reviews.Author: Mark_Jonesy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fabulous setting, surrounded by water and with a stunning view of San Diego from the front. There is a delightful marina around the back and the general area is very pleasant. We were given a King Room on the 1st floor , unfortunately our door was under the stairs to go to the second floor so it was very dark and we had absolutely no view from our windows at all, which was disappointing. The bed was very comfortable and the room had a massive flat-screen TV as well as nice touches, such as a refrigerator and microwave. The bathroom was very nice except we had to call maintenance as we had a family of ants come to visit! Thankfully after a treatment of bug spray we only saw the odd one or two for the rest of our stay. We did not make use of the restaurants on site however we did use the swimming pool twice, which was very clean and in a glorious setting. Another bonus was that there was free Wi-Fi throughout our stay which really pleased me. I would recommend this hotel, however if you are needing to go to downtown then I think having a car is a must. If and when we return to San Diego then we will seriously consider staying at this hotel again - I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Close to the city but an exotic retreat”
Reviews.Author: LILY45AZ23
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 days there after daughter finished her conference @Convention Center( for that we stayed at Marriott Marquis Marina more convenient) then we chose Best Western Island Palms; spoke to the local hotel (not 800#) & got 2 rooms next to each other at the Casa Marina- their newest building. It was wonderful & so quiet on Shelter Island Drive. We were on the 3rd floor with gorgeous view of the marina. The grounds have nice trees & plants, at least 2 pools, 2 tennis courts & a restaurant which we did not have time to try. Kids can go to playground across the street on other side of marina with water view, the hotel will give out tide timetable so if anyone is interested can check out tide pools, one can watch pelicans, cormorants, ducks, etc... We got reservations in Aug. for Oct. free airport shuttle, wi-fi & free parking! wow.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - shuttle not so much”
Reviews.Author: TKANDTJ
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very well maintained, staff are very helpful, room was clean,quiet and comfortable - decor a little dated but bathroom had lively updated granite counter and shower stall. The food is great and priced reasonably. Breakfast would have been nice to have been included - at least continental - but with fridge and microwave we were able to get our own breakfasts for couple of days. The only issue we had was with the shuttle. It's complimentary - they are flexible - they picked us up at ship terminal and drove us to airport – then they drove us back and forth to our car rental (thrifty on pacific ave near airport is cheapest – good service) so they are generous with this service. However we arrived at harbor at 10:30 ready for pickup – i phoned the hotel to let them know we arrived – nadda. 11:30 they finally show up – there were 10 of us from the ship going to best western – ALL OTHER HOTEL SHUTTLES HAD COME A GONE!!! We were the only one left standing in the hot sun waiting. Their excuse was shuttle does not start until 11 am that day. So half hour to get there they figured they were on time. Tell that to the 10 people left waiting!!! Then they found there were too many to pick up so the driver (in this case the hotel manager) suggested we wait another hour for him to get back. To even suggest that was insulting!! I made a point of suggesting the hotel comp a taxi – which he agreed to without hesitation. Other experiences with shuttle we later learned – when you book a shuttle for pick up at say 4 – they take it to mean they will leave the hotel at 4 – keep that in mind. They have free bikes, nicely situated by the harbour – but you are very far from catching public transit – keep that in mind when you book here. That’s why we rented a car. Free parking at hotel. They have a deal with a car company that will drive the car to the hotel and pick it up for you for the low price of $39 a day – i was told by the company ‘you won’t find a better price for car rental in san diego – if you find a car at all. Yeah right!!! I phoned thrifty and got a car for $19 a day – shuttle drove us back and forth for pick up. They need to find a better car provider – someone a little more honest. I won’t mention the name of the company they use – but stay clear of that lot unless you have money to burn.

Reviews.Title: “This was an awesome room!!!”
Reviews.Author: lindyhopper63
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a king suite because my husband is a "Diamond Member" and it was fantastic!! It had two bathrooms, a separate sitting room for watching their hi def tv. Another tv in the bed room. Plenty of towels. A balcony off the master bedroom. A beautiful view of the marina. The only thing it did not have was a continential breakfast. But you could buy breakfast at their restaurant located inside the hotel. The a/c worked great!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and wide choice of accommodation to select from”
Reviews.Author: Mazneed
Reviews.Content: We have visited San Diego six times in total, three times staying on Mission Bay and three times now on Shelter Island and this location is definitely the one that we prefer. The hotel is in two main parts, the original buildings and then the Casa del Mar buildings, which I think at one time was a separate hotel. This results in a wide range of accommodation being available, you have a choice of either a Marina view or a view of the inlet that leads to San Diego harbour. There are pros and cons of each, but we have settled for the marina side, feeling it is generally quieter (it does not overlook the car park.) The rooms are spacious, if a little warm, even with air conditioning - our room had the biggest TV ever, superb quality! The hotel is easily accessible from the airport and easy to get into the town, there are a number of places that you can eat locally, they are within walking distance. As with most BW, this hotel has free wifi, but if you don't have your own computer, there is one in reception that you can use free for 15 minutes. There are two swimming pools and hot tubs. If you just wanted to chill out, you could stay in the hotel and not explore the surrounding area, but you would miss out on a lot if you didn't visit San Diego itself with the Gas Lamp Quarter, Seaport Village, the Old Town, Balboa Park and the Midway, then within easy distance is Mission Bay, La Jolla and Coronado - there is so much to do round here, San Diego is a really great place for a vacation and you would go a long way to find a reasonably priced hotel with excellent facilities in a quiet location. When we return to San Diego there is no doubt where we will return to.

Reviews.Title: “Island Dream”
Reviews.Author: Livelygadabouts
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights from 11th September in a Jnr Suite in the Casa Del Mar Building overlooking the Marina - fabulous service by all the staff involved - pool area excellent - easy to get around San Diego from Hotel either by car or trolley bus or boat trip. Fabulous evening venues and restaurants to visit within walking distance - special thank to Chris, Sean and Aisha - excellent from the Deli on Shelter Island Road overlooking the Marina - excellent lunch also in the Blue Wave Restaurant on site. We really recommend this Hotel for all kinds of holidaymakers, youn or old.

Reviews.Title: “Oceanside peace and quiet at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: traveler46_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for 5 nights in late Aug 2011 in a North-facing, 2nd floor, queen suite facing the marina. The suite was fully equipped with a full kitchen, separate living area, large clean bathroom, and separated bedroom area. Living area comes equipped with a very comfortable sleeper sofa. The bedding was excellent, the area is quiet, there are plenty of restaurants with a short walking distance and plenty more within a short drive. The Shelter Island area is very secure and the south side is essentially an oceanside park, complete with BBQ areas and a beach. Check-in and out was problem-free, airport shuttle was prompt and quick. It was a pleasure to stay here and we will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing stay... great accomodations”
Reviews.Author: stephanierae92
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night during a quick weekend getaway trip. One night wasn't enough! The service was great, staff was friendly and the rooms were clean and well kept. The views were spectacular. We had a room with a harbor view and a balcony. It was very relaxing and quiet. We will be returning for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Marina building”
Reviews.Author: midon1
Reviews.Content: This is a sprawling low rise hotel. The Marina building is new The room is large with a large stand up shower no bath. The king size mattress is adjustable soft hard etc. The other rooms seemed older. We were not in them. The restaurant is very good and inexpensive. Pool is well maintained. You really need a car if you stay here

Reviews.Title: “Rocky start, but turned out well”
Reviews.Author: poco01x
Reviews.Content: Checked in to find we had been booked into a corner room with a very small balcony. Very disappointed and tried to find a different room. The only other available was also a corner room, with a slightly larger balcony. Figured we might as well stay where we were. Went back to the original room to find the A/C not working, building tech said it was frozen solid. Ended up moving to the second room, but the entire process took about 1.5 hours. TV in that room, failed that night. All the problems were nobody's fault and the staff worked very hard to accomadate us. The rest of the stay was very nice with great views of the harbor and ships leaving and arriving. Nice grounds and very clean, friendly staff that works hard to please.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: eyedoc1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed here twice in the last few years. All we look for is a comfortable place to sleep as we rarely spend more than a night or two in any one place. As such, we don't normally have the chance to explore all a hotel has to offer. Our experience is that this hotel is reasonably priced, in a convenient location to the airport and downtown, and is quiet and comfortable. The pools are clean and well maintained and the hot tubs are, well...hot. Just the way they should be. We also love the view of the marina. The staff are helpful and courteous. We will probably stay there again when we return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but an older hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Scottsdale_from_IL
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in late August. The hotel is well kept for an older property. It is right across the street from the sound and you can watch the boats go by. There are several good places to eat nearby. (I will review them separately.) The two main complaints are that the carpet was dirty and made our white socks show the dirt. Also, the walls are very thin but we usually use ear plugs when traveling, which I recommend here. Not a bad experience but would probably try another place next time.

Reviews.Title: “Old property-Nice location”
Reviews.Author: jakd602
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel. There is nothing nice or new here. The location is beautiful, right on the water, but the rooms are about like a Motel 6. The restaurant served a great breakfast. I would not stay here again. I will spend a little more for a nicer room.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best Western”
Reviews.Author: JimTChristchurch Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: A good location with yachts on either side of the hotel and a nice room although a little way from restaurants and any night life. Car parking was a bit difficult. We had a door to the front of the room that led to a small seating area on the front. When we arrived we were given a ticket for a complimentary American breakfast in the restaurant. On arriving in the restaurant we had to wait some 10 minutes to order and were, eventually, given a coffee. We then had to wait 30 minutes and eventually gave up on the breakfast. There was no one around to take our complaint and we had wasted the best part of an hour not getting breakfast. Eventually the hotel provided a couple of muffins and danish to see us through the morning. Not well organised in the restaurant and it wasn't really busy in there.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: harzie
Reviews.Content: The pictures on the web make this place look like a 5 star, which it isn't. However it is very clean and the views are very impressive. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: SenorGregorio
Reviews.Content: We spent the week in San Diego staying at the B.Western Island Palms on Shelter Island. This is much superior to the average Best Western in a beautiful setting between the Coronado Island channel and the Shelter Island Marina. Our room was large and clean with a lanai overlooking the Marina. The bed was superior to the "Heavenly Beds" at the Starwood Resorts. A very good restaurant on site, the Blue Wave. The hotel is convenient to everything in San Diego that a tourist would want to see. Service was generally competent and friendly. Beautiful waterside park across the street for long walks to neighboring restaurants for dinner and back. Elevator to our room was out of service for nearly a week. OK with us; we took the stairs. A chore lugging our luggage up 2 floors on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: MarianneTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Best Western was nice. My husband and I stayed there for 5 nights. We spent most of the time seeing the sights of San Diego with extended family of several generations who live in San Diego. Most everyone we encountered who worked there was very friendly and helpful with the exception of one young woman at the front desk. I don't recall her name. We ate breakfast at the Restaurant most mornings and had dinner there one night. The food was good, but I think overpriced. However, I always think hotel food is overpriced. I used the whirlpool one night. It was a bit too hot. I wanted to get bottled water from a vending machine, but it didn't work at all. It would have been nice to have complementary coffee available. I used the in-room coffee pot, which only had decaf. I don't like the non-dairy coffee creamer that is generally in hotel rooms. It was good to have a refrigerator in the room to keep beverages and fruit and yogurt in.

Reviews.Title: “Not Happy with Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LadyMT_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on Thursday, September 8, 2011. There was a power outage in all of southern California that went into New Mexico and Arizona also. We had no power for 12 hours!! Very little was done to make the guests comfortable at this hotel on that day. A few sandwiches were made (not enough for everyone), and neither myself nor my husband got one. There was ice water that they provided. They also brought out apples, bananas, and some lettuce salads later on, but it was dinnertime and we wanted something way more substantial than fruit or lettuce. We went to several local businesses until we were able to locate a convenience store that was open and selling things in the dark without the use of any cash register, etc. To top things off, when I questioned at the front desk if there was any plan in place for food, I got attitude from the front desk clerk! We checked out the next day. Did not like the location of the hotel. We ended up checking out the next morning and went to a Comfort Inn and Suites where we were very happy. This hotel is old having had upgrades done to the rooms but still an old hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: luckiest1
Reviews.Content: We returned for a family reunion and stayed for two nights. Having stayed at the property a year ago, we knew we loved the great location, beautiful property and great service. Once again, the wonderful staff delivered, the rooms were in great shape and you just can't beat the location! Staff gave great restaurant recommendations less than five minutes away. We also had a great breakfast at the resort out on the patio and the food was great. You can be at Seaport Village, Cabrillo Monument, Fort Rosecrans, downtown and the Midway in less than 10 minutes etc. I'd suggest a marina view if possible, but bayside is great too.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay and I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Deb7111
Reviews.Content: Book a room with a marina view and awaken to a quiet, peaceful view of palms and yachts. Our Island Palm room had a little patio right on the edge of the marina. It was quiet, tropical and peaceful with a beautiful breeze. Our room was clean with very comfortable beds and lovely white linens, granite bathroom, and a small fridge. Nice, helpful staff. It well exceeded our expectations and we look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable. On our shortlist when we come back to SD.”
Reviews.Author: Andres C
Reviews.Content: The area was quite attractive and felt very safe. The hotel is well managed by a friendly, professional staff. Shelter Island has but a few hotels and restaurants and so it feels exclusive, but at the same time the public parks and pier makes it accessible and family friendly. About the only trouble you might have is parking, but the hotel included parking in the price so we didn't have any problems. The room we were in was at the Casa Del Mar Building. We had a King with small fridge, microwave, very comfortable dining and living room. Plenty of room for our 9 month old daughter to crawl around. Also had two plasma TVs and two sinks in the bath area. A small, but nice balcony with views to the harbor (next time I'll go for Marina View). The property has two pools and nice areas to walk both in front and back of the building. There are plenty of excellent restaurants within 10 miles and also a few supermarkets. The room we had offered a small fridge so we saved money on breakfast and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “We will return”
Reviews.Author: TripsAgain
Reviews.Content: Very nice room - newly decorated - nice view of the harbor

Reviews.Title: “Worth paying for the marina view. We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Dfenz
Reviews.Content: We've visited San Diego a few times over the past 10 years and have struggled to find a hotel we really liked and would go back to. I think this year we've found the one. What makes this hotel so special and worth the not inconsiderable $$$ is its location. We opted for a marina view room and were not disappointed. We've stayed at hotels where marina views mean getting a glimpse of the ocean between two trees 100 yards away. Here you get exactly what it says on the tin. We had a perfect ground floor room with unobstructed marina view only a few feet from the water separated only by a pedestrian path screened by shrubs. Our room had outside seats and a table and it was very relaxing to unwind at the end of the evening with a few beers and a good book. The added bonus was that the fireworks from Seaworld were clearly visible each evening. The hotel is on an 'island' which means its surrounded on three sides by water. The lobby side faces a strip of parkland suitable for walkers and cyclists and offers good views of the bay and any aircraft carriers in port. The room itself was very clean and well maintained. Beds were very comfortable and the bathroom modern with a spacious shower. Reception staff were friendly. Breakfast was the only disappointment. Not so much the food but rather the poor service. There is nothing more annoying that seeing people arrive for breakfast 15 minutes after you've sat down and they are served first and finished before we even got our food. They got what I'd regard as normal service whereas our server was attrocious. The service the following day was slightly better but not fantsastic given the prices. The food was fine and the location, overlooking the marina, is excellent and refreshing. The hotel is conveniently located but will require a car to get the most out of. Parking is plentiful although given the layout of the hotel it is unlikely to be parked outside of your room. If looking for something to do check out the Midway aircraft carrier museum. If visiting the museum make sure to go early in the day as its at least 4 hours of a tour and it closes at 5.30. The tour of the bridge may close even earlier. A useful tip if travelling from Anaheim is to check out any of the attraction booklets in the hotel rooms in Anaheim. A book in our room contained cut-out coupons that allowed children to get in free which was far more valuable to us than a dollar or two off general admission. Security at the hotel was very prominent with a security guard passing our room regularly as I downed the beers! We will return to this hotel next time we are in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning location”
Reviews.Author: EssexRon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a self planned tour with my wife and 11 year old daughter. This was our fourth hotel of the trip and when we opened the door to our room we all danced a little jig. It was marvellous. Lots and lots of room (in Casa del Mar building) even with two beds, easy chairs and a good sized dining table and four chairs. Well equipped kitchen area too and lovely views over the marina. Swimming pool was a delight and staff were very helpful. We would all thoroughly recommend this hotel and will certaily stay again if we get the chance

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Pheonix555
Reviews.Content: What a place - we had a great view and the room was delightful. The bed was very comfortable and the facilities were excellent. The 2 pools were both clean and very nice for a dip. The location is fantastic for visiting San Diego and is short walk to lots of extremely tasty restaurants. The only down side were the bikes which we were excited about before we arrived. There are so few it is very hard to actually get one and when we did they were barely rideable and could do with a few repairs. I did let the front desk know, but not sure how interested the chap behind the reception was. We loved this place and will stay there again when we visit San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: Antman70
Reviews.Content: After 3 hectic albeit fun HOT days in Vegas, we drove here and immediately felt at home. We loved the place - quiet, picturesque, it just felt nice! The room was modern and clean. The guest laundry was a godsend and the cocktails by the pool were awesome. There are also some great eateries just a short walk away, but don't discount the hotel restaurant - they cook some awesome ribs. Next time I'm in San Diego, this is the place I'm staying!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed Island Style 10 minutes from everything...”
Reviews.Author: Linescrew
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in the 3rd week of August for a couple's vacation. Location was more relaxing than staying downtown or somewhere with more urban development. The hotel is located on Shelter Island, which is essentially a mile long strip of land with hotels and marinas. We booked to stay in the Casa Del Mar building which I understood to be a better part of the property. Our reservation said "water view", but to be fair, virtually all rooms are water view as the island is only about 100 yards wide. Our room was facing the road and was a bit more noisy, especially on Saturday night. I would recommend you have a room facing the marina for a more quieter experience. The property has a nice on site restaurant, the Blue Wave Bar & Grill. The food was excellent for the price range. Room: average sized, with balcony. Coffee maker and a safe are also in the room (no charge). Cleanliness was good. The only issue was a slow draining sink in the washroom. Parking: free, but can fill up at night. Amenities: there are two pool areas, both of modest size. One (it seems) is more noisy with families. A free USA Today is available in the lobby, too. We attended the Hawaiian Luau at the Kona Kai Resort just up the beach (held in the summer on Friday nights and highly recommended!) Room service is available (we used it for breakfast), and service was prompt. All in all, any issues we encountered with this property were minor and we would recommend this property to anyone wishing to stay in the area. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful getaway!”
Reviews.Author: jdf1987
Reviews.Content: Wow, this place is amazing! I took my boyfriend here for his birthday, and I couldn't have picked a better place. The service was wonderful, the hotel is very nice and clean, and the atmosphere is amazing! Perfect place for a romantic getaway!!

Reviews.Title: “lovely city,brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: charie1999
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the end of a Californian road trip and it was the perfect place to end a brilliant holiday.Perfect location,outside of the busy city but easily accessible and gorgeous views of the marina or San Diego bay.Our room had two king beds in one room and a sofa bed in the lounge,a good sized bathroom and a good sized kitchen==perfect for 5 of us.The pool area was lovely,the restaurant fab and really reasonably priced especially at lunch and happy hour! The portion sizes were generous too.We found all the staff to be happy and very very helpful and we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: G S
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. We were really surprise with the room we received for a guestroom reservation. We had a great room with a private patio, great views of the bay, short drive to many of the great sites of San Diego, great views of the marinas. Entire staff very professional and friendly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to San Diego. We plan on staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could stay longer”
Reviews.Author: CinnamonBon
Reviews.Content: We took a quick trip to San Diego and stayed here for only one night. What a great hotel! We booked online and were upgraded to a room with a beautiful view (a great view of Marina!) upon arrival. The hotel room was clean and updated, bathroom had no tub, but very spacious and modern, sparkling pool and a restaurant with decent food and reasonable price. We ordered room service for breakfast and it came right on time. We're definitely going back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - great spot in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Kevin T
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 15 minutes from town on Shelter Island a lovely Marina spot. Easy drive for airport and all amenities with local shops and restaurants. Lovely relaxed atmosphere. Teenagers loved the pool(s) - as did the adults. Great restaurant serving both guests and boating community. Spacious rooms (we had suite 2 Kings plus Bed settee) worked great for family. Definitely thinking of a return!

Reviews.Title: “Management is Responsive”
Reviews.Author: LLBean314
Reviews.Content: We spent one Saturday night (for a wedding). We were pleased that the hotel accepted a one-night reservation for a weekend night in August. We had several problems. Climbing into bed late at night, I noted fresh red blood stains on the sheet. It was a small area, and I was tired and didn't want to wait around for whoever is on duty at midnight to bring me new sheets, so I covered it up with a pillow and slept on the other side of the bed. Arose early, plugged in the coffee pot, and then discovered that there was no coffee or tea. So I went to the restaurant, rather than wait for room service to bring some packets. Breakfast in the restaurant was excellent and the service was very attentive. Management sent the routine follow up e-mail, so I decided to point out these two issues. The manager responded immediately, and went so far as to offer a credit which I hadn't asked for. Very professional, and the right thing to do. I assume these were rare glitches at a well-run hotel. I mention this incident, not to dissuade you from staying here, but to provide reassurance that management is indeed responsive to guest concerns.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: ke1234
Reviews.Content: We (family of 4, two small kids) stayed in a Junior queen suite for 3 nights. Everyone was very friendly, the room was large and very clean. We enjoyed the hotel and would return.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay in a lovely location”
Reviews.Author: mtjon007
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a Best Western. They are generally good, decent hotels and represent good value. Go there with this in mind and you'll be happy. The rooms are good, not great. I personally thought the beds were vert comfortable. The two pools are nice. Good loungers. Very limited parasols. The staff are excellent. There was an immediate response to our phoning reception to explain that our room had not been cleaned on one of the days. The staff at reception are very helpful and knowledgeable. The location on the waterfront / marina is excellent. It is very quiet. Providing you are prepared to walk there are certainly 4 good restaurants within 1km or so. I'd also like to give a special mention to a place called The Wine Pub which is near the above mentioned restaurants. It's a lot like a wine bar with some decent beers and they get some good musicians in there. We hope to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful... just right”
Reviews.Author: Heatherpm
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we had just gotten done dealing with Fox rental car... what a nightmare. Upon check in we were told we had been upgraded due to my husband's birthday. It was great. The hotel was in a great location. First night the kids swam as my husband and I sat at the poolside fireplace.. just beautiful. Normally I opt for the cheaper hotels, but glad I spent a little more for this one. Well worth it and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Had problem with reservations”
Reviews.Author: JSW348
Reviews.Content: We also booked our room in advance, and when we got there we were told they could not guarantee the room we booked. We also were told that the room was a handicap room, and they gave it to someone else. We booked it entirely for that reason. The front desk ( boy) was extremely rude, and basically told our handicapped member that the other guest was "more handicapped".. (??)....They did nothing to fix the situation, and we had to "make do". I think the hotel should advise people that they WILL NOT book the room you request no matter how long ahead of time it is booked. The hotel is nice, but they seem to have a problem with their reservation department. We will not stay there again. There were also exposed outlets with wires hanging out, and the tv cabinet swung over the bathroom door locking someone in bathroom until we got back to free them.

Reviews.Title: “A slice of Southern California beach-town"”
Reviews.Author: skotwerner
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Comic Con and it was so nice to take a short bus ride back to Point Loma after a day FULL OF CHAOS, to the laid back feeling of a small beach town. This place is like a Secret spot you don't want to tell too many people about......The Island Palms Hotel was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location on the San Diego Bay!”
Reviews.Author: shadrachsmom
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a beautiful place. It had a view of the boats and bay from both sides. The rooms were nice for a 3 star place, and we were pleased with our stay. The front desk and other employees were very friendly and helpful. It was nice for a hotel to have a larger, modern TV, most have older ones. I highly recommend eating at the restaurant for breakfast. The food and coffee were delicious and the prices were very reasonable. Also, eat at Miguel's, a Mexican restaurant down the street. They have AMAZING food. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Would return because of the good service”
Reviews.Author: annettefandwlver
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego for a holiday with my 19 year old son. His first time and my 4th to this wonderful city. Its been over 10 years since I was here and when I booked this hotel online I had no idea where it was relative to tourist attractions and the airport.-important factors since we were here for only 3 full days. This hotel is close to the airport, the zoo, Midway Ship Museum, Sea World and downtown. It's close, yet far away, because Shelter Island is a mariner's enclave that is at least 5 miles from shops, restaurants and night life. There were a cluster of restaurants within a 5 minute drive of the hotel. All of the retail and restaurants cater to mariners because this is the home of America's cup, ergo yacht clubs, marine shops, seafood restaurants and dive shops. The restaurant menus we looked at were above average price range and not within my budget, ($15-20 per person for dinner). Exceptions were Miguel's on Shelter Island Dr. which offers wonderful Mexican fare and is highly recommended. Great atmosphere, menu, service and prices. Our room at this hotel was very nice. It was spacious, clean, and had a large bathroom with a shower, no bath. The room included free WiFi and I appreciated the plug in bar on the desk for all of our laptops and cell phone chargers. The room had a mini fridge, microwave and coffee pot. There are two pools. The one closest to our room and the lobby had a hot tub as well. Towels and restrooms were poolside. Drinks and light meals were offered by servers that made the rounds for guests lounging on the pool deck. There is a gym but its small and the equipment is not great. Being the gym rat that looks for an easy out to exercising I took one look and decided I would rather walk along the sea wall or paddle in the pool. The room was fairly quiet. The plumbing backed up one night and we were without water-sink, shower and toilet-for an entire evening. The staff were extremely apologetic and gave me a key to use the marina bathroom and shower. At check out I was given a refund for our breakfasts that we had charged to our room for the inconvenience. The breakfast menu at the hotel was excellent, restaurant service was above average and the food was delicious. One of the best things about this location, and I did not discover this until we arrived, was its proximity to Humphrey's Bar and Grill. This hotel/restaurant has a series of live summer concerts with some really good headliners. I saw Keb 'Mo the last night of our stay. It was a 10 minute walk from our hotel. I also liked the quiet scenic setting of this Best Western hotel, loved the friendly service, comfortable rooms and bed and proximity to major San Diego tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable hotel in Unique location”
Reviews.Author: WahEee
Reviews.Content: We are a family with kids aged 2 and 10. There were quite a few downtown and Gaslamp hotels on sale at the time I booked, but we decided on this hotel due to its unique location that offers a bay view frequented by both gigantic carriers and small fishing boats alike. Very San Diego. The Gaslamp area was good for wine and dine, but with kids we do think this area is safer. The bonus of this location is its proximity to the airport, which is handy as we never know what the traffic situation is anywhere in southern California. We are upgraded to an Island Palms one-bedroom suite with kitchen facing the bay, from a Del Mar junior suite. Our room is double the size of the guestrooms on 1st floor, therefore I think those guestrooms are pretty small. The bay view is as good as the marina view, but as the bay facing units also face the car park, some noise cannot be avoided esp. in the morning. During night time, it is okay. For our unit, the walls are actually stucco-like, which in my opinion is not very upscale. But all in all, the other things like bed comfort, cleanliness and shower pressure, are all adequate. The pool area at the main building is not crowded and a pool will guarantee some fun for the kids, something that most downtown hotels do not have. In my opinion this is rightly a 3-star property based on the condition of the rooms, but with this expectation in mind, you will be pleasantly surprised at the location and its great value compared to other pricier alternatives such as Paradise Point or Dana.

Reviews.Title: “Just awesome!”
Reviews.Author: BudgetTraveler81
Reviews.Content: This was an awesome experience. We stayed 3 nights here to celebrate a birthday. From the moment you drive up to the property, you are taken away by the view of this place. Upon arrival, we were greeted by Danny at the front desk. He was very courteous and friendly. He also knew all the answers to the questions about the area and San Diego in general. Provided us with great tips, maps, and must-see attractions. When we entered the room, the first thing you see right away is the awesome water view. The room was very spacious, clean and had a nice size bathroom. The housekeeping staff also did a great job while we were out of the room. We did go to the restaurant on-site and had their breakfast, although it is not complimentary, it is well worth the money. You get great service, great view of the Marina and good food. All 4 of us ordered something different and were not disappointed. Check out was easy and quite honestly, did not want to leave. This location is a must stay if you really want to experience Shelter Island/San Diego away from the noisy freeways and the hustle of the big town.

Reviews.Title: “Made my trip from the east coast to San Diego worthwhile!”
Reviews.Author: phillyburbs8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few weeks ago and I just could not believe this place. From the views of the marina and downtown to the hotel service it was great. When I come back this is my first choice of hotel. The island it's on is beautiful and not far from the hustle and bustle. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, marina & beach & town”
Reviews.Author: txtanbeachbum
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to Point Loma, so within a mile you can find multiple restaurants and stores. The one at the resort wasn't very pricey, but didn't have a lot of options for our picky 7yr old, so we ate out in town. The hotel is old, but updated and clean. The check in was quick and plenty of parking (free of charge). Across the street is the beach and sidewalks which were full of walkers at any time of the day. The weather was perfect when we were there. My son loved watching the Navy helo's flying over from the base across the way, and seeing the seals by the parked boats swimming around. We were in San Diego for the week sight seeing, and chose to stay here toward the end of our stay when we toured the USS Midway and the Zoo. Neither are super close/walking distance, but if you are okay with driving they are about 5 minutes away when traffic isn't bad. We had wanted to use the Marina services and do some fishing, but ran out of time. The pool is a bit chilly once the sun starts to go down due to the shade, but there is a large hot tub. For the price, service, and location it is 5 stars, but is it a 5 star resort, no. Did they meet all my expectations, yes.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't sleep well”
Reviews.Author: kiwifuz
Reviews.Content: My title says it all. Independent of anything to do with the hotel, its staff, the room, etc., if I don't sleep well a hotel is out for me. We normally sleep in our room and not much more. My problem with the room? It had shutters rather than curtains over the front windows. That's a problem as soon as the sun starts to come up. We had a great view of the water, BUT the sun rose over the water and woke us up bright and early! UGH! I’ll be completely honest, part of the problem was that we had a late night at Disneyland and then drove down to SD the same night, but it shouldn’t be out of the question to sleep in past sunrise. Our room was had kind of a funky decor. We had a king bed and a couple of chairs in our room. Along the wall opposite the bed there was this long dresser-type thing that held the TV on top, the refrigerator & microwave inside, and drawers for clothes. This piece of furniture was pretty worn looking. The bathroom had a toilet, nice long countertop with a sink, and a shower stall. I’m not against only having a shower, but this shower was rather dark (no lights in or near the shower) and didn’t really have a place to store all of our shower goodies (shampoo, shower gels, face wash, etc. from home). The heat/ac came from an in-wall unit. Parking was close, in front of our room or very close by. We had a little gate into an area outside of our room where we entered. From our doorway we could see the water. It was pretty cool when we saw the USS Carl Vinson ship out (didn't know it was going to be until I heard about it on the news and then opened my door!). The staff was fine. The room was clean. Our bed was comfy. I just can’t handle being up at sunrise because the room doesn’t have curtains. Shelter Island is a great location due to its proximity to downtown, the airport, freeways, etc. Our view as great, when I wanted to see it. I will not go back, nor would I encourage anyone I know to stay at this hotel. Sorry but blaring sunlight is a big no for me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice getaway”
Reviews.Author: kngkeith
Reviews.Content: Very nice setting on Shelter Island. Our single king room was a bit small, but was in excellent condition. We chose a marina side room, very quiet, except for the typically noisy window type a/c.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - convenient and comfy”
Reviews.Author: sowestsue
Reviews.Content: Loved this place - reasonable prices and free parking - easy access to all San Diego vacation amenities. Ask for a place away from the pool if you need quiet. Accommodating front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Would absolutely return”
Reviews.Author: mtcboston
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice for the price. The staff was friendly and accomadating. Housekeeping was excellent and the location is beautiful. The two pools were within easy walking distance from all of the rooms and were well maintained and clean. As a bonus you can see the Sea World fireworks nightly from the pool area. The only con I can think of is the parking. If you get back late you have to park across the street as the hotel has a very limited parking area, but even this was not a big inconveinence as the lot is directly across the street. I would recommend staying at this hotel and would stay here again if back in the San Diego area

Reviews.Title: “Great location, recommended.”
Reviews.Author: KayKayTee
Reviews.Content: Located between the marina and the bay this hotel is in a great location. Rooms were nice with a small balcony overlooking the marina. Restaurant was good with very friendly staff. Would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, surprisingly central location”
Reviews.Author: Staidthere
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at Best Western Island Palms while we were visiting a friend in downtown San Diego. Both the room and bathroom are large, clean and well-decorated. There are electric sockets everywhere, including at lamp bases. The plasma TV had most major channels. There was a good refrigerator, and wi-fi was free and fast. The view of the marina and hills from the porch is very pretty. Our room 670 was on the top floor at the end of Villa Marina, the building farthest from the reception area, near the tennis courts. It was easy to move suitcases from the parking spaces to the room through an extra-large elevator. Location The location is on Shelter Island only about 15 minutes from downtown and less than 10 minutes from the airport. On one side of the string of hotel buildings, there is a view of the road, parking lot, and harbor. On the other side, there is a view of the marina and the hills. We chose the marina view because we enjoy watching water birds and sailboats. We didn't eat at the restaurant because there are so many good restaurants nearby. We had a good lunch at the Brigantine Restaurant at Shelter Island Drive. Parking As you face the office, there are two loading and unloading parking places to the right side. When you check in, they provide a parking pass for the duration of your stay. At midnight it was a challenge to find an empty parking space in the complex, but eventually we found a place. Service We rarely saw the staff, but when we did, they were helpful. One of the maids offered to help bring our suitcases to the car. Check-in and check-out were fast and easy. At the office, they held our suitcases until our room was ready because we arrived earlier than the 4 p.m. check-in. Quiet enjoyment There was no neighbor noise, but there were more than usual family hall-caucuses during daylight hours. Maybe sailing families need to talk loud enough to be heard above the wind. We didn't try to sleep during daylight hours, and we probably couldn't. No problem sleeping soundly at night. The bed and pillows were comfortable. Because getting around San Diego by car is so easy, we found the Best Western Island Palms a comfortable and, at times, a charming alternative to a downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was like Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: VacationGrandma1
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a location that makes you feel like you are in your own little tropical world - this is the place for you. I traveled alone and felt safe. I will definitely bring the whole family back. This fabulous hotel gives you a true feeling of relaxation surrounded by a harbor full of awesome yachts as well as everything you could need or want within walking distance. Friendly staff always ready to help out and make your stay the best... Not to mention close to downtown to catch the city feel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Get to the restaurant, fantastic food”
Reviews.Author: mrfleetAuckland
Reviews.Content: Had read some negative reviews prior to arriving but this place is really good. Staff extremely friendly and helpful and possess a sense of humour. The restaurant is first class, casual but the food is amazing. Free Internet and parking a real bonus. Overlooks downtown San Diego on one side and the Marina on the other. Thoroughly recommend this hotel. It's close to Sea World and the Zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, excellent hot tub with view”
Reviews.Author: guigrl
Reviews.Content: Not your usual Best Western. This was a very nice hotel, more on par with Hilton Garden Inns. Room was largish, comfortable, decorated with a bit of a tropical feel, but not too overdone. I requested a room on the first floor, and it was very close to the hot tub and pool, which had a great view of a marina. In the evenings, there were very few kids to ruin the peaceful ambiance. Landscaping was gorgeous. Very nice place to stay for a weekend trip. Note - checkin and restaurant are in one building. There are multiple buildings. So if you need something from front desk, can be a pain.

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect for our family”
Reviews.Author: Cindy039
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for our family. My husband and I traveled with our 8 yr old and 5 yr old for a family vacation. We stayed in a suite with kitchenette and separate sitting area. It was great. We loved being able to feed the kids breakfast before we left in the morning and even ordered in dinner a couple of nights so that there was some good down time for the kids. They loved the pool and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “It`s an excellent spot...if you have a car.”
Reviews.Author: 1weekendwarrior
Reviews.Content: As I write this I am on my final night in this resort. Overall I had an excellent stay. My room in the Casa Marina portion was clean,with a laundry service,safe,fridge,free internet and view of the marina.The bed was supposed to be some "Revolutionary Sleep System" that had a dial for comfort, but I never adjusted the setting, I slept well enough each night. Though the walls/ceiling are a bit thin if you`re a light sleeper. There are 2 hot tubs which were great after many long hours walking all day, and a Spa (which I never took part). There are 2 salt water pools, the one near my room was only 3ft deep, but the one up near the Bar/Restaurant is 81/2 feet deep in parts, which is rare. *However some people may feel a little self conscious sun bathing or swimming around this pool as diners on the outside patio are constantly looking down on you. My only complaints - the menu though reasonably priced has a lot of fish dishes and I`m not a fan. I wish there were more meat selections as a $22 steak every night got a little boring. Also, I was here a week but didn`t rent a car, you`ll probably need one. I relied on the Hotel's FREE shuttle to get me to and from the airport, and as I was in town for a convention, that venue provided FREE transportation to and from the event each day. But there is not much within walking distance on Shelter Island except shops catering to The Marina/Yacht crowd. There is a nice walkway that you can use to walk/jog around most of the island however with a coastal view. My only real compliant is that on my first night here I called the front desk and set up a Wake Up Call for the next morning but it never came. I eventually woke up an hour later on my own. I phoned the front desk and complained because if this had been the day I was leaving I could have missed my flight - as a consolation they provided me with a FREE breakfast. * Other than the fact that this Hotel and every other in San Diego jacks their prices (and perhaps their food costs as well) from Jul 21-24 for The Comic Convention. I see nothing else wrong with the place. This was my first time in CA., I was familiar with Florida weather;hot all day,hot all night as well, here even in July it was semi-hot during the day and a bit cool at night. However there are fire places by the pool and heaters on the out door bar/patio.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely gorgeous hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: LisaSheaMA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Island Palms from July 13 through July 20 as a mix of business meetings and pleasure. From start to finish the staff was exceptional. The front desk team was always eager to help and went above and beyond in their assistance. The wait staff was super. I tried quite a number of items from the menu during my stay and everything was delicious. There are two separate pools and hot tubs, plus a fireplace near one of them. I was able to do yoga by the marina each morning which was spectacularly beautiful. Just across the street was a beautiful walk along the water which led to a beach and more restaurants. The location was a perfect staging ground - we took day trips out to Balboa Park, Torrey Pines, and a dinner cruise. There were numerous places on the property to sit and have long, quiet talks without interruption. It was absolutely ideal for both business and relaxation reasons. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Decent, clean & near family attractions”
Reviews.Author: travelingpatts
Reviews.Content: Wow! This hotel has over 500 reviews, so I will try to make my review organized and informative. We stayed here for 5 days in July on vacation. We had a total of 11 people in our family traveling, so we all ended up in 2 different buildings (2 rooms in the Island Palms & 2 rooms in the Casa Marina). One building would have been nice, but they didn't have rooms all together. (Large families/groups: book earlier than 2 months for busy times!) Rooms: The rooms in the Casa Marina were all indoors, and the rooms at the Island Palms opened straight to the outdoors. There is a 3rd building (Casa del Mar) in between, but to walk from the Casa Marina to the Palms was only like a 5 minute walk and nice if you walk by the marina! We were all right by the marina, so we had a nice view of the water and different boats. Across the street from the hotel, you can go walking by the ocean. All of our rooms were clean, but the room service fell a little short replenishing coffee and coffee cups. We did leave a little tip each day and asked for extra towels, which we got plenty of! You do have a nice selection of TV channels (at least 60). Location: Great location and no problem with noise! We were about 10 minutes away from Mission Beach, which was quite crowded. I was kind of glad we didn't choose a hotel there, because I think there was a higher chance of noise near our rooms. We were 45 minutes from Legoland, about 1.5 hours from Disneyland, and only about 15 minutes from Sea World and the San Diego Zoo, and 5-10 minutes from USS Midway and Gaslamp District. Our location made it very easy to access the interstate and main roads to these places. We were only 1-2 miles from main drugstores and larger grocery stores. Also if you like doughnuts, which all in our family do, a Winchell's was right down the street and around the corner. Good on-the-go breakfast ! Parking: free for all guests, but it seemed difficult to find a space in the evenings. Parking was also available across the street. Rate: We got a reasonable rate, an average of $140/night. We rented out a room with a kitchenette, a couple doubles with queen beds, and a double with twin beds, but that $140/night was an average of all rooms. I think this was a CostCo special. Check out the hotel's actual website: http://www.islandpalms.com/san-diego-hotels/index.cfm for prices as well. Overall: We enjoyed our stay here and had no problems with cleanliness (a MUST for me!) or noise. These qualities plus location made it worth it. We were hardly in our rooms but the beds were comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Among my favorite places to stay!”
Reviews.Author: schlarmzy3
Reviews.Content: B/W Plus Island Palms Hotel and Marina has become our home away from home during our annual summer visit to San Diego. Their staff --front desk to maintenance-- is prompt and friendly. The facility is beautiful, rooms are clean. The restaurant also has outdoor seating with views of the marina and very good food at moderate prices. We prefer to stay in the garden courtyard area facing the marina where we can catch the nice ocean breezes and have marina views as well as a lovely marina quiet walking are that goes around Shelter Island. Within walking distance to Shelter Island's beach and park. Having guest laundry and room service is a nice benefit as well.

Reviews.Title: “A Delightful Stay”
Reviews.Author: SaltedTraver
Reviews.Content: As long as you have a car, this location is great. Island Palms is a quick 5-10 mile drive to nearly all the things you’d want to see as it is situated in the middle of the main attractions of San Diego. There are beaches to the northwest, SeaWorld to the north, Old Town to the northeast, Balboa Park/San Diego Zoo to the east, Downtown and the bridge to Coronado to the southeast, and Cabrillo National Monument to the southwest, all within a 10-20 minute drive. Also, there are a few small convenience stores and decent restaurants within decent-walking distance. A Trader Joe’s and a large supermarket are a couple miles away and worth visiting if you are staying a few days. Upon arrival we were greeted with smiles from the individuals at the front desk. While we waited for them to make sure our room was ready, we looked around a little. The hotel is made up of three unique buildings although we only saw two of them. The building that includes the main lobby is very tropical, lush, and green and includes a nice tropical-style swimming pool. It also includes the on-site restaurant (we didn't try) that overlooks the pool. The atmosphere seemed a bit livelier than the Casa del Mar building where we stayed. The Casa del Mar building is more of a Mediterranean theme and quite beautiful. The pool is a bit smaller than the pool in the main building and seemed much quieter except for the 5 or 6 kids enjoying it. The view of the marina was very peaceful. The rooms are clean and the décor is fairly typical for a Best Western. We noticed that the room we got was a bit more spacious than we had anticipated and there was ample sink counter space for our belongings as well as another counter/bar. The bed was comfortable and clean. The housekeeping staff was nice and always had a smile on their faces. I have to think hard to complain about something. The only thing that comes to mind is no newspaper on the weekends – not a big deal. We enjoyed our stay and would have to look really hard to find a better place nearby. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Motel not a hotel”
Reviews.Author: TAtonull
Reviews.Content: Do not let the pictures fool you, this is a motel with a pool and no luxuary standard whatsoever, no standard at all actually.  An example, the showerhead that was once white now dirty yellow, almost fell off. The room had an odd smell, mixture of damp smell and strong detergents. We thought we might have been ulucky with our room. But after eating in the restaurant we kind of understood that this is not a place that focus on quality. Our crabcakes  tasted weird and we did not dear to eat more of it. We also tried some nachoes (looking at others food we realised we had to order something save), but not even that did they manage. We also noticed the next table did not eat any of their tuna, it seemed to be totally overcooked. If there is one positive thing about this place it must be the location at the marina.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best!!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle T
Reviews.Content: Was so nice to stay at this hotel. we came to California to visit my son who is stationed at camp pendleton Marine base. We had a hard time finding a nice place in oceanside so, we came to san Diego and got on trip advisor to find something. We found this best western hotel, its on the marina, close to camp pendleton, and not far from the beaches. We were extremely satisfied!! It was very clean and well groomed!! They have a restaurant/bar on site and they come around at the pool to check on you, that was nice!! The view of the marina is magnificent!!! The staff is so friendly and helpful. Such a nice place!!! We will be coming back!!

Reviews.Title: “It has it all”
Reviews.Author: Patsje
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an one bedroom suite with my wife and two young kids. We thought this place had it all for staying in San Diego. The suite is well equiped. We had a great view on the Marina. On the front side of the Hotel you have a great view on the skyline of San Diego. It's a short drive to Sea World and Downtown. Our 4 year old son loved the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice getaway!”
Reviews.Author: fyi92
Reviews.Content: I arrived to learn I had been upgraded to a marina view room. I had a beautiful view from my room. The room was nicely decorated and very clean. I even had a mini frig and microwave. I spent some time at the pools and they were both nice and relaxing. I walked to the Casa del Mar pool for a little less crowd on occassion. I also took advantage of the Sail San Diego outing on my last day. Georgeous views of the city and Mike was a wonder tour guide. I would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Again !”
Reviews.Author: herbieBme
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at this hotel. Again the room was overlooking the harbor with a balcony (great for sitting out at night). We enjoyed the bar after arriving and even sampled the finger food (happy hour prices were great). Loved to walk the beach at night after dinner (across the street) Breakfast was a real treat eating on the open patio (marina view) next to the inside restaurant. Found the prices to be in line with other locations. We took advantage of the airport pick up (Thanks Jacob) and even got the hotel to take us in their van to dinner one night at another seaside location (Red Sails Inn). We are now back home :( and have already made our reservations for this hotel again next year. Great friendly front desk staff (Thanks Chris) See ya all next year!

Reviews.Title: “Not a quiet get away”
Reviews.Author: Bob732
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in July for a quiet getaway to relax and enjoy the cooler weather. When we checked in we were told the marina side of the hotel would be quieter, so we opted for that side. We did not realize the room would be directly over the pool and hot tub. The pool area was open until 11:00PM with young men and women crowded into the area drinking and very loudly having a great time until security asked them to leave at a little past 11:00 the first evening. The second evening the drinking escalated to immature sexual banter and louder obscenities. That night I called the office to ask if they could be a little quieter. When the security finally arrived at about 11:15, he said "Dude, we've had some complaints, can you leave?" It was 11:30 before it resembled anything close to quiet. The hotel itself meets all the basic needs and is in a nice location on the marina. I would not advise anyone with children or anyone seeking a quiet relaxing getaway to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Kents19
Reviews.Content: This was a great choice for us - two adults and 2 teenagers - as the room was very large, and had plenty of room for a rollaway. There was a dining area, a small kitchenette (Microwave and refer and stocked with dishes). A sitting area and a balcony. The location on Shelter Island was lovely - good for walks and people/boat watching. Our only issue is that the laundry area was centrally located and we were in a separate building quite a ways away. Desk staff was very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the pool(s) and the workout facility, too.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: Dancing_Dogging
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely 3 night stay in a suite with two queen beds overlooking the marina. Great view of Marina on one side of the hotel and the harbour on the other. Everything was clean and comfortable. Pool and spa great overlooking marina. Breakfast in the restaurant was excellent. Family of ducks waddling around the resort plus plenty of seagulls with baby seagulls in tow. Shelter Island is conveniently located to most of San Diego sights. Some good restaurants within walking distance. Nice to stroll along the habour and watch the fishing and shipping and the navy helicopters overhead. Would definitely stay here again if ever in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “great relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: bigcheuk
Reviews.Content: we stayed for four nights here at the start of a driving trip. what a fantastic place to get over our jet lag. nicely fitted out rooms, nice pool, excellent bar and restaurant and really friendly staff. first room was to the front, but because of naval helicopter noise across the bay (post Bin Laden/ SEALS etc heightened security) they were happy to move us to the back, overlooking the marina, for no extra charge, when I know from booking this room was more expensive. location is great - marina to the back, bay to the front. lots of people out walking/jogging/fishing. in addition to the hotels own restaurant, there are a couple of excellent ones within walking distance. overall a great alternative to downtown/mission bay/hotel circle.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is the BEST kept secret when looking for a romantic get-a-way”
Reviews.Author: OsoSandy
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Room was large, clean and we had an ocean view. Restaurant located in the hotel had the best food. Breakfast, lunch and dinner were fantastic with great service. Shuttle service was very accommodating. Friendly staff! We will be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in! DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: madamB
Reviews.Content: We have often chosen Best Western hotels as they have always delivered exactly what was required. This one, however, was a complete and utter disaster! We arrived in our upgraded "suite" and immediately smelt a foul smell. It turned out to be the toilet bowl which was blocked and the stench had gone right through the whole "suite". We checked the bed clothes (not something we would normally do) and discovered hairs on the bottom sheet! The rooms were filthy and we could hear the family in the next rooms as it was a connecting room! The front desk were incredibly rude and said that they were full and couldn't move us. Needless to say we left the next morning (without charge) - a very pleasant guy at the front desk apologised profusely that we could not see Mr. Levin, the Manager, as he was not on the premises - and we found a charming hotel only 1 mile away. Best Western really let us down this time! A total disgrace and it was a BW PLUS! Not quite the plus we were expecting.....

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: KSJibber
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to San Diego. We were spending a week there so we wanted a comfortable, clean, and friendly place in a great location with FREE parking! We found the perfect spot! The Island Palms Hotel was wonderful! Our room had two queen beds and was extra roomy with m-wave and frig too. Clean, clean, clean! Our balcony looked over the beautiful marina. We were lucky enough to be there when the USS Carl Vinson navy ship came into port. We just walked across the street to watch the ship arrive! It was awesome. We had a rental car and visited many attractions (zoo, SeaWorld, Coronado Island, USS Midway, Old Town) and all were so easy to get to from our hotel. The front desk staff were SO helpful with showing us the easiest route to go. Each night we spent time at the pools, which were clean and warm. We highly recommend Island Palms! If you are planning a trip to San Diego......become a fan of Island Palms on facebook! Their posts will get you excited!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was an excellent stay and we will go back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Utter-Taitague
Reviews.Content: We arrived and were taken care of immediately!!!!! Thank you Robert for taking very good care of us!!! This was my very first time to San Diego and it was an excellent experience at the Islands Palms Hotel & Marina!!! We stayed a week and have nothing to complain about!! Great location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Positives and Minuses”
Reviews.Author: TAmember8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 14 - 16th June and whilst it was alright, I wouldn't rave about it and would opt to stay somewhere else next time. We were put in block B which is the older part of the complex. We didn't apperciate this at the time and had we been staying longer than 2 days, I would have asked to be moved. Our room was ground level and had a motel feel to it. It smelled a little bit fausty and had a very old fashioned - and noisy - air conditioning unit, which was perfectly adequate at the time however because it was not hot during our time in San Diego. If it had been warmer, it may not have been sufficient. We had our very own pet cockroach in the bathroom (we gathered him up in a towel and put him ouitside once we managed to catch him...) and we found the bathroom/ shower area to be very dark and dingy to be honest. We went into the heart of San Diego one night because it was a bit quiet where we were and the taxi cost us $25 there and $30 back - bit steep.... Be aware that if you want to do this it will cost you!!!! On a more positive note, we ate in the bar/restuarant one night and our meal was fabulous. The bar staff were wonderful and really friendly. In conclusion, we loved San Diego (despite the June gloom we got) and will definitely be back - we will stay in the Gaslight district next time however.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: SusanP163
Reviews.Content: Wow! What an amazing stay at the Island Palms. Four nights of a tropical paradise and awesome weather made an unforgettable stay. After a failed attempt to make a trip to San Diego last year, we finally made it this year to celebrate my daughters graduation.
