Two flat screen tvs (bedroom and living room), sofa, open concept full kitchen with fridge and stove. Coffee maker in room, and balcony overlooking the bay. It was in the older part of the complex but exceptionally maintained, and I cannot say a bad thing about the room at all. My newlywed wife was thrilled to say the least, as was I. It was much better than expected. The location is fantastic, as you can go for long walks along the bay in the morning. It is close to everything, and easy to get into downtown or wherever you want to go. We wanted to take a trolley tour, and just missed the Old Town Trolley, and would have wait another 40 mins. The staff at the front desk saw that we were disappointed, and immediately offered to drive us to Old Town. I told them that we would wait, but they insisted that it was no problem, and took us on the shuttle to Old Town. It was something they just didn't have to do. Even the waitstaff in the Blue Wave restaraunt was top notch and went out of their way to make you feel comfortable and at home. I highly recommend eating at the hotel restaraunt if you do stay here. The food and service are both comparable, if not better than any restaurant in San Diego. We were pleasantly surprised. Pool and jacuzzi are clean also. Well worth the money, and we hate to leave here to go on to our next destination. Thank you Best Western!! We will be back again, I guarantee it!

Reviews.Title: “The only place we will ever stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: madrigal_singer
Reviews.Content: This was our second stop at the Island Palms and yet again the service, location and rooms were perfect for us and our budget. Having two children under 3 we definitely need a second room if they are going to get any sleep and if we are going to be able to stay up past 7:30 pm! We have now stayed in King Suites in both the original hotel building and the Del Mar building and LOVED both rooms. They are spacious, clean, comfortable and perfectly outfited for a family. Both rooms had beautiful views of the Marinas and were cooled by the breezes off the water. Both rooms also had outside spaces, including, this last stay, a great "front lawn" area with a table where our girls could play while we ate and where they could chase the friendly ducks. The beds are ridiculously comfortable, the parking and wifi are free, the tvs are big and the water pressure is strong...all the things I want in a hotel. But there is more...the most responsive and friendly staff ever...they even gave my 2 year old pennies to throw in the fountain. Problems are handled immediately and with graciousness. And the location is great, a playground across the street, restaurants on site and short rides away, Seaworld within 5 minutes, Old Town and Downtown similarly close. This is our home away from home and the ONLY place we will stay in San Diego from here on out!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: t2beans
Reviews.Content: The room that we were given was small with 2 queen size beds. It was clean and bathroom looked newly renovated. Staff was friendly. Great location. Would stay here again when we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Professional. Polynesian. Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: LightHawkPortland_Me
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Island Palms for about a week and held several meetings and our annual banquet. The catering team were professional and patient. The food was delicious and the meeting rooms looking out over the marina were spacious and comfortable. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence”
Reviews.Author: rerewill
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Island Palms Hotel and Marina in September 2010. The room is spacious and had a view of San Diego Bay that can't be beat. The staff is unbelievably courteous, and helpful. The restaurant is top notch. The Palms is close to all major attractions. Definitely I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Liesl13
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here at the end of our 4 week USA trip. It was fantastic. The location was great, and really easy to find. You literally exit the Interstate 5 and drive down Rosecrans several blocks to Shelter Island Drive. And it's only 10 minute drive to Old Town, Sea World and the airport. The staff were very welcoming and very helpful. We had our GPS system stolen out of the car two weeks earlier and when I told them that they insisted on providing us with instructions and maps from Map Quest wherever we were going. There is a small internet desk for guests, but when this was in use it was much faster for them to provide us with the instructions. We had a king size waterview room in Casa del Mar. A very nice sized room with all amenities: fridge, coffeemaker, microwave and a balcony. Directly outside Casa del Mar is a swimming pool with hottub, and when we were there in mid-September it was not at all busy. Great for relaxation after a day sightseeing. I have seen on another posting that they offer drinks and meal service at this pool. Maybe we were too late in the season for that because we didn't see this service all 3 times we were at the pool, but it was unimportant for us anyway. One morning there were no pool towels available but once we asked for them they were brought out quickly. The only complaint we have is that our neighbors would order room service in the evening, and the used plates were still outside their room next morning at 8 am. Unfortunately they were into seafood and the plates smelt pretty awful next morning. But other than, everything was fine. We ate both breakfast and dinner in the hotel restaurant. See my comments on that in a separate posting on "Blue Wave Bar & Grill. We were also given good advice for a restaurant nearby: Brigantine Restaurant. See also my separate posting on that.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful! Pleasant! Want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: MairAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Aside from less than perfect directions from front desk, a wonderful stay. Beautiful accommodations, great decor, great view, lovely grounds, helpful staff, GREAT price. Would go back!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: junbug77
Reviews.Content: Best place we have stayed in a long time definitely would stay again

Reviews.Title: “RESORT-LIKE WATERFRONT SUITES”
Reviews.Author: MikeTObaby
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, San Diego was the worst place to go in terms of dullness and boring people. I will never go back to that boring place ever again. However, if you must go I would definitely recommend this hotel as an alternative option. Even though it did not offer breakfast, with the low rates you could just as well purchase one at dennys or mcdonalds. The suite we stayed at was only 1 yr old and had 2 swimming pools with amazing views. This is just like a resort and helps with the dullness of the city it is in.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - I would recommend it to anybody.”
Reviews.Author: anniessis
Reviews.Content: We were in San Diego to celebrate our 50th wedding anniversary. We could not have found a more perfect place to stay than the Island Palms Hotel and Marina on Shelter Island. We were in the Casa Marina building, third floor room, wonderful view of the bay. The hotel had complimentary champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries waiting for us in our room. Every staff member that we encountered was courteous, friendly and helpful. The room was large and very comfortable. We never heard our neighbors unless we both happend to be on the balcony at the same time. We felt that with all the amenities we got good value. We will go back and we will recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “New favorite place!”
Reviews.Author: DebbyT4
Reviews.Content: The building we stayed in was newly renovated and was immaculate. The beds are the kind that you can adjust the firmness, great. The window covering was full length sliding (3 panels) shutters! You could still get light in and have privacy, plus you could adjust the amount of light you got, just like at home!! Okay, so the view was great! There was a small play area across the street for kids (swings) and their was a pier to fish off of and some beach to have a fire. You could see downtown San Diego across the bay very easily since there were no clouds to be found! Everyone was friendly. Then there was the marina....beautiful! I would love to retire here with my husband and just enjoy life!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location - one to be repeated!!”
Reviews.Author: Alisonsh
Reviews.Content: The Island Palms is located on Shelter Island, which is a great location for the whole of San Diego and all of the local attractions. On arrival, unfortunately we were placed in a room which had a very noisy ice machine outside. The room itself was beautiful, but with two light sleeping children we were concerned about how it would affect them. However, when we approached Reception, they changed our room without hesitation to a much quieter part of the hotel. Despite all of the local beaches, the hotel has a small haven of a swimming pool, right on top of the beautiful marina. It also has lovely restaurant serving delightful food for both adults and children. If we have one negative, it would be that the hotel is on two storeys with no elevator, so you have to manage your own luggage - however this is a very small price to pay for such a beautiful location. When we are lucky enough to visit San Diego again, we will definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice view”
Reviews.Author: linnde
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night and had a marina view room. We arrived near sunset and outside our room was a small grassy spot with lawn chairs overlooking the marina. My guy and I had a bottle of wine and enjoyed the quiet setting and beautiful sunset over the marina. I had to catch an early flight so can't say much more other than just enjoyed those moments so much and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wish our Plumbing problems were solved in a timely fashion.”
Reviews.Author: grngirleee
Reviews.Content: Bathtub would not drain, when taking a 10 - 15 min shower. Brought to the managements attention by voice mail. ( NEVER GOT BACK TO ME ) They used liquid draino the first time, of course didn't work. Called again. Took to long to fix. Couldn't use our showers . Requested new room or some kind of compension only $100 talking off our $1000.00 bill for 3 nites. We had late starts to our days at Sea World and The zoo. Missing shows. and caused arguemets in the fam. Last Day the cocroaches were checking Inn ( Big Ones.)!! Pool was nice !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to escrape the crowds!”
Reviews.Author: mycracraft
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at this hotel. We took my daughter back to college but we also had my 10 month old with us and the hotel fit all of our needs. We stayed in the new section of the hotel with a view of the pier. The rooms were exceptionally quiet and clean. The staff was wonderful and very accomodating. Our rate included breakdfast coupons which we used everyday which saved us money on eating out for breakfast. Parking was free and we had two cars and a trailer (which they let us park in the garage for safety). My husband was so impressed with the choice and glad that at the end of the busy day with moving, crowds, the zoo. we were able to escape back to our room and the quiet area of Shelter Island. I highly recommend this hotel and it is close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: janetlouth
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing! The rooms were nice and comfortable. Great view! The staff was the most accomodating staff that I have ever experienced. They allowed us to do an early check in due to our flight status. They upgraded our room to allow us to check in early. They were great in all aspects of service. I would recommend them to anyone. The only comment for improvement that I would have is that they need a shuttle service within 2 miles of hotel. San Diego has a great public transit system so we did not get a car. However, it was quite a walk to and from the hotel to catch the bus.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, an excellent hotel in a quiet setting!”
Reviews.Author: JLdesigner
Reviews.Content: In the last 23 years, I may have visited San Diego half a dozen times and stayed in different hotels and location each time. This was our first stay on Shelter Island at the Island Palm Hotel & Marina and it will be the place we will come back from now on. Shelter Island location is great (this applies for visitor who rent or come with their own car) . It's not far from everywhere you want to go in San Diego and, when you get back on Shelter Island at the end of the day, it's like coming home in a most quiet neighborhood. Safe, clean and quiet location and hotel, you can't ask for more when you are away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: PLAJD
Reviews.Content: Asked for and got a quiet room, marina side. Room was nice and clean with a small seating area outside. Never took breakfast at the hotel, with a refridgator in the room a trip to Trader Joe's (about 5 minutes drive) took care of that meal. Did eat in the restuarant one evening, food was nice, selection was on the small side. Free parking included. Several resturants within walking distance, some located in nearby hotels and independant places. Wife used the pool and said it was okay. About a 10 minute drive to the Old Town transit centre for the transport downtown. Staff pleasant and ready to answer and queries. One small thing though, several people we spoke to ( and ourselves included ) had trouble with their car key fobs. They seemed to worked intermidiately, I put it down to the Naval Base across the water.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to hold a meeting”
Reviews.Author: Dan1118
Reviews.Content: We recently held a meeting here and the room was the right size, and the staff was wonderful. Signs were nicely placed and whatever we needed they got. Great ocean view as well to make the meeting a nice setting

Reviews.Title: “Great for business or cheap weekend away”
Reviews.Author: mauigirl2005
Reviews.Content: I paid $136 per night with AAA discount. I got a corner room in the Casa Del Mar building facing the water. I would stay here for business again. The restaurant food is perfectly adequate but not fine cuisine. I did not use the pool as this hotel, at this time of the year attracts a lot of families so the pools were often children heavy. The bed was comfortable, I sleep with earplugs in so I didn't hear much noise. During the day you can hear people outside but it wasn't too loud. I never heard anyone in the room next to mine (which is a pet peeve.) Now you are close to a naval base so occasionally a helicopter flies over or a jet and the windows do shake BUT I never once heard them at night. I enjoyed my stay and will book in here for business again. NOTE: The newer building if that's a must for you is the "Casa Marina" building. Also the wifi in my room was very temperamental.

Reviews.Title: “We would have stayed longer, if we could!”
Reviews.Author: SLOcyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Island Palms. We arrived late on a Monday evening, put the grandkids to bed. When we opened the draperies the next morning, we had a spectacular view of the marina and a lovely patio, lawn area and ducks. As far as the kids were concerned it couldn't have been better. We had a double queen suite with kitchenette. The ability to put the kids to bed and have another room to go to was so nice. Kids had breakfast and snacks easily available due to the kitchenette. And we had a full size coffee maker. Trader Joe's within about a two mile drive. A good pizza and salad place in the TJ's center. The staff at the hotel were very accommodating. The restaurant was fine, we even ordered room service one night so we could have a relaxing evening after a day at Sea World and a couple of hours in the swimming pool. An added bonus was that at 9:45 every night you could see the fireworks show put on by Sea World. This hotel is in a lovely location, off the beaten path, but near everything we wanted to do. Just a few miles to the zoo and Balboa park, Sea World and freeway close for the trip to Legoland. I do think the marina side rooms have the best views. Pool was clean and not overly crowded even though the hotel was very full. From the front of the hotel you can see the skyline of downtown San Diego, really beautiful at night. Also, there is a park and walking trail across the street. I read one complaint about the ducks. For us, the sound of ducks is preferable to the sound of traffic, take your pick. We would have stayed another night if there had been availability. The staff did everything they could to try and make it work for us. We will go back again and plan for a day of relaxation at the hotel and surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: colin_william_wilkie
Reviews.Content: There is no way this place is a three star. This place is amazing. Where do you start? The location to everything is perfect, you are surrounded by a beautiful harbor, the rooms are spotless, the staff is amazing, the pools are heated and are never overcrowded. We were there in the middle of July, the hotel was packed, and we never had a problem getting into the pool. To find a downfall with this hotel, would be amazing, because I have stayed in many great resorts and hotels and the Island Palms could stand up to any one of the. Great place and I can't wait to come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice suite”
Reviews.Author: Luv2g0lf
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great, nice view of the water on Shelter Island. It might have seemed a bit remote but it was very easy to navigate to all the locations we wished to see around the city. I would much rather stay here than downtown. The suite layout was nice with a good kitchenette as well. We really enjoyed our stay here and I would certainly recommend this hotel to other families.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: WorldcitizenArizona
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel. Before booking I did a lot of research and since I didn't know San Diego I relied on the reviews. The location on Shelter Island is great. It was close to the main attractions (about 4 miles from Sea World), yet It is peaceful and quiet with incredible views of the city and the Marina on the other side. Steps away from our room was the Shelter Island pier and park with a small children's play area. You could take a nice, pleasant walk on Shelter Island to get away from the bustle. The hotel itself was great. We stayed (based on recommendations) in the Casa del Mar building, which is a newer building, a little bit far away from the reception. Our room was large and spacious with a kitchenette, two large double beds and flat screen TV. The kitchenette had dishes, glasses and silverware for 4 and a small fridge and microwave. If you are traveling with kids, this is an ideal set up. The room was very quiet and peaceful. There was plenty of free parking at the hotel and free Wi-Fi, something I heard that other San Diego hotels are charging a premium for. We stayed 3 nights and had absolutely no complaints. I would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but a few hiccups”
Reviews.Author: Cherrybom
Reviews.Content: this is a nice hotel to stay however we did book for 2 queens and got 1 king bed. they were fully booked and couldnt change even though i paid for the room 5 months prior. they gave us a free trundle bed for my 4 year old and our 1 year old slept with us in the king. we were not offered any other compensation which was a little disappointing considering we were now very cramped but I didnt ask for any either. If it was just my husband and I the room would have been very spacious, comfy bed, big TV, fridge and large bathroom so would have been perfect. free parking, however make sure you request that you are not near the service road between the restaurant and rooms as its very noisy. the staff had no consideration to guests making loud banging noises, loud conversations right up until 11pm and then again at 6am - this was probably the biggest let down of the hotel also make sure you have your do not disturb sign if you are not early risers as the cleaners knock on your door about 830am to clean. also its not close to downtown so you need a car but we were happy with location

Reviews.Title: “Paradise with the friendliest staff ever.”
Reviews.Author: Richie174
Reviews.Content: My family - my wife, my teenage son and pre-teen daughter, and myself - all came down from Long Island, NY to get away for a weekend in July. We saw great reviews of this hotel on Tripadvisor, so we figured we would give this hotel a shot. Although we were a bit skeptical to stay at a Best Western (we usually stay at Hyatt's or Hiltons), we were absolutely blown away when we arrived at this property. The hotel is located on Shelter Island, a small peninsula located in between a private marina and the beautiful San Diego bay. It's just minutes away from pretty much every landmark and point of interest in San Diego. The location is convenient enough to get anywhere in about 10-20 minutes, but is also sheltered and out of the way of all the big city noises and distractions. The hotel was very nice and clean. The overall property has a secluded Hawaii theme, which makes it all the more relaxing. There are two pools, both which were kept clean and warm. There is also a fitness center, although it is a little small, and I would probably recommend taking a jog along the bayside instead of using the fitness center. We stayed in the Casa Marina building. We were told it was brand new, and it most certainly was. We got a room with two queens and a rollaway mattress, and it was still spacious enough for the four of us. The room was clean and was always stocked with amenities. The staff, however, is this hotel's greatest asset. Everyone was very friendly and always asked us if there was anything we needed or wanted. The housekeepers always gave us everything we requested. The front desk was especially awesome. They were very helpful and seemed to be very interested in making us happy and comfortable. John pretty much acted as our personal concierge by recommending restaurants, telling us which sites and places to visit, and always arranging transportation for us. And Greg was wonderful when he offered to print our boarding passes when we couldn't figure out how to use the printer at the hotel's provided computer terminal. Overall, the hotel was a beautiful property with a 5 star staff running it. We will definitely be staying here again and will be recommending this hotel to all of our friends who want to experience Southern California the right way!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not the Best”
Reviews.Author: john12360763
Reviews.Content: I went here from June 23-24, 2010; after my flight back to Minneapolis was canceled due to mechanical problems on the plane. We left the next day; enjoyed a poolside dinner at the restaurant the night before. The pool, just like the one in La Jolla I stayed at for the past week (La Jolla Shores Hotel), went from 3 1/2 feet to 8 1/2 feet. Only; the La Jolla one only had 3 1/2, 4 1/2, and 8 1/2 foot depth markings plus the meter depths; while the one here had ones saying 3 1/2, 4 1/2, 5 1/2, 7 1/2, and 8 1/2 feet. They didn't have meter/ yard depths and skipped the 6 1/2 foot marking. Just like La Jolla, the hot tub was 3 1/2 feet. I really liked the pool and cafe. Friendly staff. The only access to my room was from outside, but I didn't care. Nice hotel. This inn deserves a nice 8.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: MikeElPaso_Texas
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel tucked away in the middle of everything! Found it on the internet and can not wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous suite, exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: mamamontalvo
Reviews.Content: Was presently surprised when we showed up for day 4-7 of our vacation at how awesome out upstairs suite was. (& we were in the older section--would have never guessed by the rooms). Only downfall, was the only bathroom was through the master bedroom and not seperate area for toilet, so experienced some waiting with 7 people in our group. Very comfortable beds with nice white down like comforters, and beautiful plantation blinds throughout-flat-screen tv in bedroom. The bicycles were for sure an added bonus-all sizes and we had some great bike rides with beautiful views. Can't say enough about the staff--each and every one of them were so helpful in various ways. Pools were very nice-perfect temperatures. Plenty to do in walking distance. Nice playground, pier, & small beach right across the street. Free use of computer in the common area really came in handy. Free parking. Nice grassy areas for sitting and overlooking marina. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: minibella
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice place to stay & the staff are great. Free shuttle bus to pick you up from the airport. The shuttle driver will also drive you into town. We stayed out late one night & the shuttle bus service was over, and the hotel offered to pay for a cab for us ! We ended up hiring a car the next day & the front desk helped with that also - we just found it easier to get around and there was only one restaurant there so it can become quite pricey. They had a free computer with internet. Rooms were great with really good views. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here!”
Reviews.Author: lawdee
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the hotel. We were there for the 4th of July and it was wonderful. I read another review that said they prepaid and so weren't treated very well. I couldn't disagree more. Our trip was pre-paid and the staff was wonderful. From check-in, when I asked to be put into the Casa Del Mar room, to stopping in for information, to check out. When I asked for Casa Del Mar I was accomodated with a smile. Our balcony had a perfect, perfect, view of the Big Bang Fireworks show. We toured the island on bikes {which by the way were free} and took advantage of all the hotel had to offer. The only downside was there was an awful smell in the hallway our entire stay. Also the carpet in the room seemed old and not very clean, otherwise we loved the room and the bathroom was very nice. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in! I usually stay at the Bahia when I go to SD but after seeing the reviews here decided to give it a try. I will always stay here from now on when I am in SD.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view, super helpful staff, and great family envoirnment”
Reviews.Author: JandMplus3
Reviews.Content: We booked a stay here for 1 night after going to seaworld on July 2nd. We had car trouble and even though the hotel was sold out as soon as a room opened they called to let me know so we could stay a 2nd night while we fixed the car. The staff was so helpful and understanding. Great view right on the Marina and even had bikes free for use to keep our twins busy. Amazing location with a great value overall. Will definately stay here again!!! in fact we were so impressed we have decided to make this an annual outing for 4th of July.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: DoctorWhom
Reviews.Content: If you want a high-end resort, with officious managers, overzealous bellmen and overpriced mediocre dining, look elsewhere. If you want a nice, clean, relaxing hotel in pleasant surroundings, this is it. It's on Shelter Island (which is really a peninsula, by the way) so the rooms face either San Diego Bay or the marina. We stayed in an Island Palms Water view Suite (living room, bedroom with bath), facing the marina. I'd recommend this side of the property since the it's more picturesque and quiet. The room itself was nice. Not great, but more than adequate, and very clean. It was in the older building, but didn’t seem in dire need of upgrading (except for the small, old fashioned picture tube TV in the living room. That was kind of lame). This particular room comes with a full kitchen, complete with pots, pans, plates and utensils. And since there’s a Vons just up the street, we generally ate in, and saved a ton of money (which we promptly spent on other stuff). There's a fitness center right off the lobby, but it has to be the smallest hotel fitness center I've ever seen, about the size of a school nurse’s office. It has a treadmill, stationary cycle and a weight machine crammed into it, but that’s it. You can, however, borrow one of the hotel's bikes and ride around the area if you feel the need for more exercise. We didn't try the on-site restaurant, but we did go to the bar and had some of the appetizers, which were very good. The staff was friendly and helpful. I’ve been in higher end hotels and had far worse service. Perfectly pleasant. I’d stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: jswsant
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over Spring Break for 2 nights. When booking the reservation I was hesitant since on the map the location seemed out of the way and possibly inconvenient to the attractions in San Diego. I was wrong. Everything is in a comfortable driving distance and the property itself is very serene and relaxing after a long day of touring. The room was spotless, the beds comfortable, the property well maintained and the bathroom was nice with upgraded travertine tiles and granite countertops. There was a coffee maker and mini fridge in the room which helped with bfast and being able to pack lunches. We didn't eat at the properties restaurants but Winchell's donuts is also close by for an affordable bfast alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended- great location and view”
Reviews.Author: a12548
Reviews.Content: This hotel located mintues from the airport yet it seems a world away. We had a 2 room suite overlooking the marina. Peaceful, wake up to seagulls, a true relaxing experience. The front desk went above and beyond by offering to help print an email I needed. very peronable front desk staff. Many restaurants nearby. Room was clean, wireless internet signal was slow at times, no big deal. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: anoArcadia10101
Reviews.Content: My family and I booked a three night stay at this hotel based on the great reviews. I got a deal on line by prepaying. As a result, we were treated like second class citizens by the hotel staff. The beds in the first room we stayed at were so old and delapidated, the springs kept popping into our backs as we tried to sleep, not that we got much sleep. When we tried to get a different room, as soon as they saw that we had prepaid, we were given the run around. I certainly cannot recommend this hotel. I have stayed in better and cheeper motels. How this hotel gets so many stars is beyond me.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, great view!”
Reviews.Author: JanePeters
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the reviews on Trip Advisor. And we are so happy we did. Danny made us feel welcome the moment we entered the lobby. We stayed in a second floor Queen Suite at the Island Palms with a marina view. While clean, the exterior hallways of the older building are a bit run down from the sea air but once we entered our room we could not have been more pleased. The room was so clean with a very updated look. The living area and bedroom had a ceiling fan and plantation shutters. The decor was tasteful and the kitchen had a bar with four stools which was ideal when eating in. Our view was just lovely (nice yachts!) and the location was quiet. We took advantage of using a the hotel bicycles to pedal along the harbor and we also walked the boardwalk which has a small playground. Grocery stores, Vons and Trader Joe's, are about two miles away. Location is ideal for visiting Balboa Park and Ocean Beach, and it's a quick ride to the airport, too. One last thing, we had drinks and appetizers at the Blue Wave restaurant. The Shrimp Trumpets and Seared Ahi were to die for. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: justuskats
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly, and the amenities are fine - nothing elaborate, but acceptable and very clean. The pool and spa are great!

Reviews.Title: “pure pleasure”
Reviews.Author: seem123
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this amazing hotel for 3 nights.It is beautifully located next to marina.In the morning when i opened my room door there were ducks outside which was such a lovely sight for my little daughter.Staff was very friendly and helpful. They have a nice restaurant near the pool . They have ample of parking space

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: bigwalt4
Reviews.Content: I had scanned a number of websites for reviews prior to making the reservation and in doing so I found this property to be quite a bargain. We booked a junior suite in the Island Palms property for my wife, 2yr old daughter, and inlaws. All of us were impressed with the cleanliness and amenities of the room. The beds were comfortable, the room came with a full kitchen, large bathroom, living room, and patio with a view of the marina. The hotel itself was clean, it was located in a safe neighboorhood, right accross the street from a small beach, and the hotel staff were extremely courteous. Breakfast and lunch at the hotel restaurant were extremely well priced (nearly all breakfast items ranged from $7-10) and the meals were served in a nice environment. We had breakfast upon arrival on a deck that overlooked the pool and the marina. We arrived at the airport 9:30AM; after calling the hotel for a shuttle, we only waited 10 minutes before being picked up. When we arrived at the hotel, the staff promptly checked our bags until a room became available (check out time was noon). While waiting for a room we played at the pool and walked the property. When a room became available, the hotel staff brought our bags up for us. Two days after our trip ended, my wife and I were still remarking about how wonderful the hotel and hotel staff were. We highly recommend the place and will definitely return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Brenda4070
Reviews.Content: I was originally going to stay at another Shelter Island hotel, but after reading the reviews on this one compared to the other, I decided to book this one and boy am I glad. I paid for a water view and asked for a nice view of the bay in the 'special instructions' box and I got just what I asked for. Check in was quick and easy and check-out was effortless. My room was clean and the bed comfy. The only 'complaint' was the noise from the helicopters from the Navy base across the bay, but it wasn't intolerable and the people who had the room directly across from mine kept slamming their door every time they came and went. So not necessary. Either way, I will definitely stay there again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family hotel in a gorgeous setting”
Reviews.Author: SeattleFamily_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night after finishing a fantastic Holland America Line Mexico cruise, and it was a wonderful end to our vacation. The hotel is only a short cab ride from the cruise terminal. The setting on Shelter Island is gorgeous, relaxed, and very family-friendly. Our two-year-old loved the great playground right across the street from the hotel, where we flew a kite and had a picnic. Our teenager (and her dad) loved the free loaner bicycles offered by the hotel. While our two-year-old took his afternoon nap in the room, I sat on the balcony and got to look out at the beautiful harbor view, and watch my daughter and husband enjoy riding bikes together on the gorgeous biking/walking path (there are paths all over the hotel property and island). Perfection! Our room was a standard room with a balcony, but felt very luxurious and new. The pools and restaurant are fantastic and moderately priced. Best of all, the service is the friendliest I've experienced anywhere, EVER. Seriously! We stayed here once before (on a cruise 4 years ago) and it is still my favorite hotel, even one of my favorite places on earth. We can't wait for our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay here”
Reviews.Author: Neil_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights recently and really enjoyed it. The room was a little old fashioned but it was clean and good sized. The bathroom was great. Pool was good although it was heated which I thought was strange. Staff were friendly and we enjoyed the marina location. 10 min drive to centre of San diego. Loved sd and would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Patti250
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Island Palms on Shelter Island for 5 wonderful nights. What a great place! 2 swimming pools and hot tubs, a marina on one side and the ocean on the other....both with pedestrian walkways, a dining room and bar, and the most comfortable beds ever! The staff we encountered were friendly and helpful, especially Billy the manager who made us feel very special and always made sure everything was just right. He definitely went the extra mile.....Thanks Billy!! Chris at the front desk was also very personable and always had a big smile. We would definitely stay there again. Brian and Patti

Reviews.Title: “We wished we could stay LONGER!”
Reviews.Author: TexasGal806
Reviews.Content: This hotel was SUPER EASY to find. All the great ratings on Trip Advisor lead me to this hotel and I am very glad to have chosen it! The guys at the front desk are very sweet and check in/out is a breeze. We were pleasantly surprised that we didn't book a "view" room, yet in our opinion we stayed in one! I had to check to make sure we were in the right room! We had a little patio and were facing the front of the hotel which looks out onto the bay! You have a little beach right within walking distance - plus a fab view of down town San Diego. We loved this little area! We were able to walk around and look at all the boats! Which are great! It's also within walking distance of restaurants and weather makes it where you want to walk outside! The room looked great! We had a huge TV and shower! They have green efforts in place, which is awesome! Pool was never busy! It was such a relaxing area! When we go back to San Diego, we will be staying here again! Plus - you can totally take advantage of the many online deals that offer great prices on rates!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: butterfly362
Reviews.Content: Our room was a Junior Suite, very spacious, beautiful view of the marina. We ate breakfast in the hotel's restaurant, which was next to the pool and you had a view of the marina. The service was good and the food was delicious. I was also surprised that the pool was heated and opened till 11 pm. Hotel is close to Seaport Village and Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, waterfront gem - perfect for family vacation”
Reviews.Author: latchitravels
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Island Palms Hotel and Marina was very relaxing. We all loved our room and the view, the swimming pools and the whirlpools – again with the great view - and the fact that we could borrow hotel's bikes for the afternoon to do a little bit of neighborhood exploration made our stay! Honestly, your hotel felt like we were somewhere on exotic island on a very relaxing vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Attractive location with friendly if overstretched staff”
Reviews.Author: valise
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a long promentary between a recreational marina and the harbour providing lovely walks along the narrow park along the waterfront. The property consists of a long string of low level buildings (I think they expanded by acquiring the hotel next door) with the Reception and restaurant in the first third of the stretch. My king room was spacious and comfortable, though decorated in a rather depressing brown and beige. Being right next to an exit , the crash of the very heavy outer door (not on soft closer) jolted me awake several times. Try to specify a room further down the corridor! Plus points: very friendly staff, at all levels, nice pool near the restaurant (there is another very small pool by one of the other buildings)a fitness room (which they don't seem to mention on the website) Minus: the Reception desk is always busy and there was frequently a queue. There were constant problems with the wifi and the lobby PC during my stay and the incoming shift never seemed to be updated about this or other issues. A favourite item of clothing of mine went missing from the room right at the beginning of the week (I don't think it was stolen: being all white, my belief is that it got accidentally scooped up with a sheet change) I just wanted the staff to check this out with the laundry, but it never happened (or, at least, no response was given to me) and there was no note of it at Reception, despite me reporting it about 4 times. The lack of staff on the desk caused a real problem on the last day, when the driver of the courtesy shuttle to the airport failed to turn up to work (with the Reception staff seemingly unaware of this) and the staff were trying to deal with a long queue of people checking in and out and not getting to grips with our potential late departure for the airport. It is quite a way to the main part of town or the various sights, and taxis took a long time to come - I would definately advise a car.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: CTfantozzi
Reviews.Content: great location, great views. clean rooms. very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “If You Want To Sleep Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: cruisejunkie
Reviews.Content: Our stay was from April 20, 2010 trough April 24, 2010 Upon arriving, we were pleasantly surprised with the hotel. It was beautiful and in a great location. We stayed here 4 nights before leaving on a cruise. The first night we were awakened by what seemed to be a herd of elephants in the room above us. It sounded like someone was jumping or stomping on the floor. You could here every footstep. The ceiling made creaking noises due to to walking on the floor of the room above us. Ear plugs didn't even help. The next two night were the same. We finally couldn't take it anymore, so 1:00 am we called the desk and complained. I was told security would handle it. It was quiet for a short while but it started up again. The next morning we spoke to a staff member at the desk. He was very sympathetic and told us that it was a wedding party that was staying in the room above us. He offered us another room, actually an upgrade. He also gave us a gift certificate to help us feel better. We had high hopes for the last night of our stay. The last night was worse than the others. We could here people yelling out in the parking lot, 4:00 am, talking and running in the hall outside our door, all through the night and a television playing and people talking in the room next to us. The walls must be very thin. We would definitely never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “VERY helpful staff in recommended hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Malsville
Reviews.Content: We were staying here just for 3 days at the end of a 3 week American trip but then the Iceland volcano misbehaved on the day we were due to depart!! We knew we probably couldn't fly but had to go to the airport so asked if we could come back? They said, of course, just let us know! We were fetched back from the airport in the hotel shuttle and delivered to the car hire firm the next day. The hotel was fully booked for the following weekend but they said they were sure we could stay....just bear with them. They found room for us and even kept it at the same reduced rate because of our "circumstances". Every day they asked how things were going & if there was anything they could do? On the day we checked out to fly home they said to ring if there were any last minute problems. So many refugees (as we were smilingly known) of the volcano have reported being ripped off at hotels and treated really badly but not the Island Palms. They are a credit to what good hotels should be!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant hotel and staff - would definately re-visit”
Reviews.Author: BeverleyT
Reviews.Content: We had been travelling round California having started our holiday in San Francisco. We chose this hotel for our last 4 nights as we thought it would be a great place to relax before coming home. We booked a 2 x queen bed with marina view for $145 a night, but when we checked in they only charged us $109 which was a bargain given the beautiful spacious room and gorgeous view. The room had a fridge, microwave and HD television. There were 2 pools, the main one near the lobby, and a quieter one alongside the marina. There were plenty of clean towels and the hot tub was so warm it was delightful. The night before we were due to come home our flight was cancelled because of the volcanic eruption in Iceland. As it was Saturday night and the hotel was nearly full, we were advised we could extend but the rate would be $170. When the Manager heard the situation we were in, he said we could stay as long as we needed for just $79 a night. They didn't even downgrade our room and let us keep our beautiful marina view room. We stayed a few extra night, then decided to make our way to Palm Springs to wait for a flight home. This move was purely because of the bad weather in San Diego. We could happily have stayed in this beautiful hotel. There was a laundry on site which was fantastic - it was much needed as we needed as we needed to refresh our clothes. The breakfasts in the restaurant were pricey, but they were delicious! We cannot recommend this lovely hotel and it's helpful staff enough.

Reviews.Title: “For breathtaking and relaxing, click here!”
Reviews.Author: lakeMiGirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was EVERYTHING other Trip Advisors said it would be. We stayed for two nights in April and we were told by the very nice Front Desk Manager that we would be in the new Casa Del Mar. Basically, we were upgraded and he told us that because if we stayed again and are placed in the older sections of the Best Western, he didn't want us to be disappointed and to understand that we were upgraded. And man on man, our room was awesome! Beautiful view of the marina and a very short walk to the smaller of the two pools. Very clean room and facility, overall. We loved our sleek bathroom. The bed was very comfortable and we thoroughly enjoyed our deck with two chairs. We will stay at this hotel again and in the Casa Del Mar portion.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! GREAT location and value!”
Reviews.Author: carolsugg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here prior to attending a convention in the downtown area of San Diego. Our first night (of 4) was in a mini-suite facing the marina in the Casa Del Mar building. This room was not one of the remodeled ones and had several problems (A/C not working - looked like someone had kicked it, phone didn't work, old - and small - TV, TV cabinet had to be propped open with the ironing board since the doors kept closing). When we mentioned it to the front desk the next morning, they immediately arranged to move us. I told them that I was somewhat disappointed in our room since Trip Advisor had spoken so highly of the newly remodeled rooms in Casa Del Mar building. Those were the magic words! We were moved to a beautiful, corner suite on the ground floor for the remainder of our stay (room 410). We faced the marina - although a bay view would've been fine as well since the entire area is so scenic. Free parking and high-speed internet (unlike our convention hotel downtown). Can't say enough about this place! Even had coin laundry on site (we were in San Diego for a total of 10 days - so this amenity came in handy). Ate dinner at the on-site restaurant "Blue Wave". Very good - and had breakfast delivered to the room one morning. (This is Best Western?!) Will we return? Yes! Yes! Yes! Would love to go back and catch an outdoor concert at Humpheysby the Bay - which is right next door!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: MNMIKEEdenPrairie_MN
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed two nights at the Best Western Island Palms hotel on San Diego's Shelter Island. Good location - close two the major attractions like the Zoo, Sea World, Balboa Park,etc. Property was generally well kept both inside and out. There is an on site restaurant which we had breakfast at one morning and found it to be good - not great. This hotel has an outdoor pool and whirlpool. The pool is very warm and a pleasure to swim in. The whirlpool was a bit hot for my personal liking - others may find it great. Our room was on the side of Shelter Island which faces Shelter Island Drive. The other side faces the marina. Both have advantages. We watched as the USS Carl Vincent Aircraft Carrier came in to port. Wouldn't have seen that if we had been on the marina side. Staff was very helpful and pleasant to deal with. There was a nasty rain storm the one night we were there and a small leak developed. We reported the problem and they comped our room in full for that night which was more then fair. The source of the leak was quickly identified and easily fixed - we kept the room. Only a nasty driving rain would have caused the leak in the first place. The room had a king sized bed, ceramic tiled bathroom floor, good sized updated ceramic tiled shower, granite bathroom counter, flat screen TV, two stuffed barrel chairs, and an outdoor patio with patio chairs facing the channel. The decor was updated and fresh. If you don't like upstairs neighbors we would recommend that you try to get an second floor unit as this is an older hotel and you can hear the pitter patter of little feet on the ceiling. Our room was $126 per night and since we didn't plan to spend much time in it was a good value for a place to sleep. Across from the hotel is a walking path which a play ground, fishing pier, numerous bronze sculptures and a nice (small) beach with fire pits. There are a couple of nice bars and restaurants nearby. Humphrey's Back Stage Lounge - great live music and reasonable prices. Small so get there early and stay for a few hours to enjoy the music and dancing - short walk from the Island Palms. Also a short drive from the hotel we found a restaurant called Fiddler's Green (steak and seafood). See my separate review of this restaurant. Go there - you won't be disappointed. Bottom line is nice hotel, good value, and super location.

Reviews.Title: “We'll Definitely Return! In Fact, We Wish We Were Still There!”
Reviews.Author: BusterBee
Reviews.Content: At check-in the staff was courteous, helpful, and friendly and things only got better from there... The location is fantastic. Shelter Island is convenient to downtown/Gaslamp, Point Loma, and main thoroughfares and freeways. Plus, it offers great views! We stayed in one of the hotel's new buildings and our room overlooked the beautiful Kona Marina and Point Loma homes in the distance. Standing on the terrace taking in the salt water was such a great way to start the day! Our room was brand new, so it was fabulously fresh and nice with a large flat screen TV, comfortable beds and sheets, and a spacious bathroom. I've stayed in many nice resort hotels in the Loews and W chains and this room certainly rivaled those, it felt like a 4, maybe even 4 1/2 star room. I didn't look inside any of the rooms in the older parts of the hotel, but from the outside, they looked to be nice. The hotel is laid out like a resort with a number of out-buildings, tennis courts, a lounge, a nice fitness facility, walking paths, and two pools. One of the pools is quieter and smaller and was used by mostly adults and the other pool was more lively and was frequented by families and those who wanted to order drinks poolside. We tried both pools, both were heated, sparkling clean, and the pool areas were nicely laid out. I prefered the quieter, smaller pool, since I enjoy sunning and didn't bring kids. One of the few (and I had hardly any) complaints about my stay was that a couple of times kids were running around the smaller pool, which was normally very quiet, and I had wished they'd head over to the more family friendly pool. Perhaps the Island Palms would considering making the smaller pool an 18 and over spot and the larger pool all ages? Also, the hottubs were quite crowded at night. Understandable for a busy, sought after hotel, but adding additional hottubs or larger ones might be a good investment for the future. We enjoyed the free parking and never had difficulty finding a space. Hotel staff let us know that sometimes parking is tight at night, but that even in that case, the port owned parking lots across the street are free and open for overnight parking. Perfect ,since renting a car is a must if you want to see many parts of San Diego during your stay, it's not really a public transit accessible city. We ate at some nearby fish houses and greasy spoon breakfast joints, it was great, definitely felt there is a Shelter Island sense of community combining weekend boaters and those who work in the boat trades. We also ate lunch at the hotel restaurant and had drinks and appetizers at the lounge. The service and quality were good but not outstanding. The convenience was fantastic. I believe a continental breakfast was offered to guests as well, but we didn't take advantage. As I said, our room was very comfortable, but the walls were not particularly thick. One morning we were awoken by loud people at the marina and in the hotel hallway. It was spring break at many schools the week we stayed, so maybe that accounted for some of the activity? It was, however, very quiet at night, we were able to sleep soundly. We were also very impressed by the security presence. We frequently saw friendly and courteous (but not imposing) security guards walking the grounds, so I'm confident that if there had been excessive night time noise, the problem would have been dealt with. In terms of activities, it's wonderful that Shelter Island is convenient to a number of San Diego tourist attractions (at least by car), but there were also activities right there on the island. The beach park run by the port authority had sculptures and other public works of art, historic markers, a great view of Coronado Island, and good sitting beaches and picnic areas. There was a local arts market on Saturday and Sunday as well. The hotel offered free beach cruiser rentals, which we didn't have time to take advantage of, but they would have been great for exploring the island. We did see the beach cruises however, and they were brand new, high-end bicycles. For the sake of writing a fully comprehensive review, one of the hotel vending machines did eat our money, but minus that kind of minutae and the couple other small items I mentioned above, it was darn close to a perfect stay! All that for incredibily reasonable rates! We were certainly impressed and would recommend this hotel to anyone--couples, singles, kids, old, young, you name it, this place has wide appeal. Thank you Island Palms management and staff!

Reviews.Title: “Repeat Guest!”
Reviews.Author: heatherdarbs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found this hotel when we randomly stumbled upon it. We were stopping by all of the “trendy” hotels in effort to accommodate our wedding guests that were coming from out of town. We live a couple hours north, so we were searching for ourselves, our wedding guests and our wedding party (friends, etc.). This place is very unique – we loved it and so did everyone else. Chris Bartholomew, Director of Sales set us all up with great suites and rooms and extended the bar hours so our guests could continue the night after the wedding. Everything was absolutely perfect – our room, the service, the food, the bar, the VIEWS, and most importantly the cost! We enjoyed our stay so much, that we went back - and Chris continued to make our stay a priority. It’s not your typical hotel; if you’re looking for an interesting place to stay that will meet all of your needs – stay here.

Reviews.Title: “What a Amazing Spot, Go! Go! Go!”
Reviews.Author: corinneandtroy
Reviews.Content: We can't wait to go back ! Stayed in the newer part of the hotel. Balcony faces the beach watching military watercraft, pelicans, joggers, blissful location truly. Fred the bartender kept us company while we waited for our room to be ready, great hotel ambassador. Wonderful front desk staff, couldn't do enough for us. Big room, Granite tops, clean as a whistle. The pride in their City shone through, and staff took the time with us to be tour guides and make recommendations

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: MarieSunnyvale
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with a last minute deal so, we weren't expected so much. But it was nice. We had a view on the boats, very quiet. The room and bathroom were very clean. They didn't charge us for a crib in the room (it's the first time). There are 2 pools with jacuzzi, their restaurant is nice also. I would recommend this hotel but with the view on the boats (the other one is not so nice: parking lot and street)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, decent renovated motel”
Reviews.Author: Allcard
Reviews.Content: Nice location, renovated bathroom....it doesn't really bother me that this place has some of thair of an older motel to it. Nice bed and TV. Not particularly well insulated rooms, can hear noise from above, side, stairs etc. Decent but not outstanding value for money. I'd stay there again, but not in a hurry to go back...

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the right price”
Reviews.Author: MH-60_Lover
Reviews.Content: Our military family of four got a great deal, "50%" off, for our spring break. Hotel has a new and old section. We were given a room in the old section, bottom floor, window/door facing parking lot. The room was small and a "window-type" A/C unit did the cooling, no couch or tables w/chairs. Now, if you can get over that, which we did, it is a nice place to stay. The beds were good and the room clean with no smells, and a little fridge was nice. The pool area was nice and cozy and the location is superb. Again, we had kids, and the pool was great as was the huge park along the bay directly across the street. The area leading to the island, and the island itself was in great location, not run down and felt very safe. We took a chance and stayed here as to not stay at Hotel Circle. It paid off as we felt the area was more "San Diego" than the strip of hotels off the highway. All the good sites to see were about 10 minutes further away, but a bad commute at all and the location on the water made up for it. The hotel staff was friendly and our overall stay was enjoyable. If you get a good deal on the "basic" room, you'll be happy as long as you don't plan to spend a lot of time there. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This is more Motel than Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pagz
Reviews.Content: Think doors right out to the parking lot versus in a corridor. DIm ligting in one of the bathrooms forced us to switch rooms. I travel extensively for business and leisure and normally wouldn't stay at a place like this. It was a good location for visiting SeaWorld and for hanging out in Old Town. Free parking is a bonus too. Overall would say our stay was just OK. Staff is good, but I'm used to much nicer, newer hotels and this is definitely an old, old location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great "little getaway hotel", wonderful service . . .”
Reviews.Author: SapphireHouston
Reviews.Content: I took my 15 year old twins and 20 year old daughter to San Diego for my oldest daughter's birthday, we were focused on the zoo as she wanted to see the Pandas, however, so many places to see are very close to this hotel's proximity (del Coronado, USS Midway, all beaches,), that I would definitely go back to this hotel for the ease of getting from place to place. It's a quiet, quaint, unique hotel. Parking right in front of our room was a pleasant surprise due to my experiences in other tourist locations.

Reviews.Title: “peaceful and tranquil location”
Reviews.Author: blatimer
Reviews.Content: We were able to cancel our downtown reservations and stay on Shelter Island thanks to Danny, who was most helpful throughout our stay. Simon saved the day when he helped us get back into our room, the battery in our door having gone dead. He responded quickly, once the front desk finally called upon him. Shaun was also extremley helpful upon checkout, clearly concerned about our "lock out". My only wish would have been to have had Danny or Shaun available when we were stranded in our hallway with groceries and a pizza, unable to get into our beautiful jr. suite. Unfortunately, they were already gone for the day. We would definitely stay here again:)

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Saturday8
Reviews.Content: This place is across the street from the parks and paths along the waterfront of San Diego Bay. It is very quiet and the rooms were a good size. You will need a car to see the sights, but the traffic in this area is calm and the sights along San Diego harbor are easy to drive to, as is the airport. Th e hot tub and pool were sparkling clean as were the rooms and the grounds. As for value, this is a hands down winner.

Reviews.Title: “Great view at a great price”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugKansas
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely view of the marina from our window. We were on the ground floor and were able to sit in chairs on the small grassy lawn in front of our room. It was a very relaxing and peaceful location. The bedroom was a bit small but we weren't in the room much so it was fine. The bathroom was very large. Although the hotel appears to be older it was updated and very clean. The price included free internet but no breakfast. Free parking was provided which was not true with most other hotels in the area. The total cost with taxes was $110. A very good price for this fabulous view.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay when exploring San Diego!!”
Reviews.Author: photoguywisconsin
Reviews.Content: This was a great place for us to stay when we recently visited San Diego. It is really centrally located. Most places of interest are fairly close by. The airport is just a few minutes away. The hotel itself has nicely kept grounds and the rooms were very clean and modern, We stayed in the Casa Marina building. The staff was wonderful, especially Danny, Bob and Sherese. These guys were exceptionally helpfully with traffic and travel advice. Did I mention the free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfect”
Reviews.Author: RogueMonk
Reviews.Content: I can't add anything to the numerous reviews already submitted for this property. Its clean. Its in good repair. The staff are great. The location is beautiful. The pools are nice. We stayed for six nights and didn't have a single complaint. This is the best stay we have ever had. As always, of course, don't over expect. This is a 3-Star hotel. As long as you expect that, you can't go wrong with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have ever stayed in, anywhere.”
Reviews.Author: SJtravelerMN
Reviews.Content: First, the location is phenomenal, right near everything, including the airport and car rental services, but on a dead end street at the end of a spit so the traffic is minimal. The hotel setting is wonderful, with fantastic views of the bay on one side, the marina on the other. There is a nice bay front park and walkway across from the hotel for picnics and viewing the San Diego skyline. Quiet at night (except the occasional military air craft-it is San Diego after all), and not too busy during the day. The hotel itself is kept immaculately clean, as are the rooms, and has a lot of charm. The only hotel on Shelter Island to offer free parking. The pool and hot tub were clean, fun, and easily accessible from our room via a sidewalk and key entry gate. Our rooms were doubles, which were very tastefully decorated, comfortable beds and pillows, wide screen LCD tv, hidden refrigerator in the dresser, and the nicest bathroom of any place I have ever stayed (the extend-able lighted make up mirror was so useful, I'm looking to buy one for my home bathroom). The staff are one of the biggest assets of this hotel: Danny a the front desk managed to get us checked in over 4 hours early, and one of the other gentlemen, who's name I have unfortunately forgotten (but its the nice man with the cool British accent), took the time to print out our boarding passes for our flight home at the front desk! Friendly, knowledgeable, courteous professionals at all levels. If you are going to San Diego for business or pleasure, this is the place to stay. I have no idea why this hotel doesn't have at least a 4 star rating, if not higher, it deserves it! Oh yes, complimentary cute semi-domesticated ducks will great you in the parking lot upon arrival! Love this hotel, and I wish I were back in sunny San Diego again right now.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: cal60Uk Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: After a few minutes delay in booking in (didn't get the confirmation from Octopus!!), I was compensated by an upgrade to a fab room in the new block, Casa Marina. With a balcony overlooking the bay, it was a lovely clean, comfortable room. Friendly maid service every day, and coffee maker, decent hairdryer and fridge, made my stay very comfortable. Bit chilly at this time of year, and extra blanket supplied within 5 minutes of asking for it. Met my family there and used one of the 2 pool areas a couple of times, again nice and clean and well serviced. Ate in the hotel restaraunt a couple of times and found good, reasonably priced food. All in all, very pleased with the hotel and could find nothing to complain about, and believe me I am very fussy!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect view, location, service and price!”
Reviews.Author: jessel02
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed by this place. This isn’t your typical hotel because all the rooms are spread out over a few different buildings. This might seem like an inconvenience, but it actually adds to the “resort” feel of it. My boyfriend and I arrived before the check-in time and they didn’t have a room available, so they asked us to come back later. This wasn’t a problem because we were starving for lunch. We came back a couple hours later and our room was still unavailable. The man at the front desk apologized and upgraded our room for free! We got a view of the water and yachts. Plus, since our room was in the corner of the building, we had large windows on two walls. No free breakfast here, but the location is great and there are tons of nearby restaurants/eateries. Considering location, room quality and service, the price of this place is unbeatable. I will be staying here whenever I’m in San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Experience I have Ever Had”
Reviews.Author: JJ121301
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and the views were fabulous. The only hotel on Shelter Island to offer free parking. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the pools were great. New bar on site and a great resturant onsite. Close to many attractions and the airport yet you have the feeling of being miles away.

Reviews.Title: “When visiting San Diego, this is where to stay!”
Reviews.Author: CeresaM
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had a great time at the Best Western Island Palms Hotel. We had rented a car so the location was perfect! It was a few minutes from every location - Gaslamp Quarter, Downtown SD, San Diego Zoo, Sea World, Old Town, etc. The hotel large and is made up of a few buildings. We stayed in the Casa Marina building, which was at the end of the hotel. It was the newest section of the building and was all modern and clean. Our balcony overlooked the marina and the hills on the other side. The sunsets from our balcony were beautiful and the sunrises from right across the street were also beautiful. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Don't look anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Jordanfamilytravels
Reviews.Content: Great staff, excellent room, great location! On the Harbor with stunning views.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful stay at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaMilly
Reviews.Content: One of the best things about this hotel is its location on Shelter Island - relatively close to tourist attractions, but feels a bit secluded. You have a terrific view of the bay, nice areas to walk, bike etc. We had a junior suite, found a great price on line, it was a lovely large room with dining area, frig and microwave etc.. The staff are the best thing about this hotel - great customer service, quick to deal with any concerns, extremely pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Efficient, and beautiful scenery”
Reviews.Author: indigoboo
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay. Room was great, housekeeping was wonderful, views were breathtaking. The only problem I had was with the WiFi. It was there, and consistantly worked, but the speeds were pretty bad.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy!!”
Reviews.Author: mdw50
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs to add some sound deadening between rooms and floors. I could even hear the guest next door dropping their change on the night stand. And the sound of the low water toilets flushing during the night would wake the dead. Also, the movie channels said "temporarily unavailable' all weekend. Housekeeping was on the ball when we called and requested a second blanket and the bed was pretty comfortable with fairly soft sheets. I must say that the view from our marina side room was beautiful tho. I was disappointed when I went to take a tub soak and found all we had was a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vckj4872
Reviews.Content: Would Stay there again. No complaints, Good service, clean and a gorgeous view.

Reviews.Title: “Better rooms were given to later conference attendees.”
Reviews.Author: nottooimpressed
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in an absolute picturesque location. Upon arrival, we were given a room in the older section of the hotel, with no view at all (neither the bay nor the marina) only the stairway and an ice machine. The room was clean and neat, but had the aroma of sewer gas. We sprayed perfume all over the room to overcome the odor, and went on about our business, but asked the next morning to be moved. We were told that the hotel was booked up for Tuesday night, so there were not options for moving. Monday night when we came back from dinner, the room smelled like urine. Again, we sprayed it down with perfume. The constant spraying helped some, but we know for a fact that other rooms were available, and feel somewhat cheated that later registrations received better rooms for the same conference price.

Reviews.Title: “Really?”
Reviews.Author: ConeRod
Reviews.Content: Have any of the people who stayed in this hotel stayed in other hotels? This is at best an average 2.5 star MOTEL. We would not have even considered this place if it had been correctly categorized. The room is heated by an in-wall head high heat pump, with a sensitive thermostat. You can't set the heat and leave the fan on, so the fan comes on and off with surprising frequency. You are near the airport so it can feel like a plane is getting ready to land in your room. The room is dated and absolutely at a 2 star finish level. The hot water takes a very long time to get hot, seriously 5 minutes. The walls and ceiling have no insulation, so sounds from the stairs and other rooms carry through the walls with little noise reduction. On the upside it is a good 2 star hotel. It’s clean, it has a pool, a restaurant, a gym and free wifi. The location is picturesque. We would not stay here again, not because we had any problem, everything was fine, but the place just isn’t nice enough. It's a good 2 star MOTEL (an important detail) but it is not a 3 star hotel. For the price and quality level this is an average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Saucy09
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. For the price it absolutely can't be beat! The rooms are a decent size and clean. Our room had a little patio and was accessible from the parking lot (we appreciated the free parking, too!). It looked out over the bay and gave us some great sunset views. The restaurant had good service and good food, and the pool was great--we lucked out and had excellent weather in the mid-70s during our stay! There were always cookies at the front desk (yum!) and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They all had a laid back attitude and were always willing to suggest a restaurant, tourist area or beach that we should visit (and also weren't shy about saying where we shouldn't bother going!). The location is a bit further away from the beach and downtown areas than I originally wanted, but with a car rental it wasn't a problem. It turned out that there were several excellent restaurants nearby, and the beach was also relatively close by. Overall I would absolutely recommend this hotel. It's an excellent value!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place”
Reviews.Author: Dablik
Reviews.Content: Everything was just great!Very nice hotel, clean rooms, quiet and great location

Reviews.Title: “Overall very nice.”
Reviews.Author: whiteheather99
Reviews.Content: Location was great. It does require a car to access things, but on Harbor drive its pretty quick to get to the main attractions, and they don't charge parking. The property is comfortable and attractive- not fancy, but very pleasant. We had a king marina view suite, which was very spacious and pleasant, although the mattress was really really bad. Our only real complaint was that it took them 2-3 days to change out the bad mattress, so we didn't sleep well until the final night of our 4 night stay. The manager was very polite and offered us lunch to compensate for the 3 poor nights sleep, but we already had plans and the harbor view restaurant was closed for renovations (so we kept our reservation on Coronado instead). Helpful and polite staff. Overall I'd probably recommend it for ppl who prefer to be away from the crowded downtown area, but inspect the room thoroughly on the first night. The other hotel we stayed at was the Indigo downtown, which was lovely, but a very different experience.

Reviews.Title: “nice location but poolside rooms a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: Kendal321
Reviews.Content: Pleasant hotel, in a nice location. Rooms had everything you needed although our location next to the pool was noisy throughout the night, with the pool being hosed down at about 3am, and again at 7am. Also located away from attractions and so food wise you have to drive to get there, although there is a restaurant on site, but this is quite expensive. But the location is very pretty on the marina with downtown lit up at night in the distance.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Quality, Good Staff, Postcard Pretty!”
Reviews.Author: ATravelerMidwest
Reviews.Content: After reading such wonderful reviews, we decided to book this hotel and we were not disappointed. Having traveled to San Diego numerous times, we had not stayed in this location and decided to see what this area has to offer. The Shelter Island feel is very peaceful and tropical, while just moments away from various marinas, Downtown, Gaslamp District, Seaport Village and the Convention Center. The hotel staff, front desk, security, house keeping, etc. were all very friendly and helpful. No one was rushed, very calm, and they provided quality service. Island Palms Hotel has three buildings, we stayed in one of the two newer builidngs, the Casa Del Mar. It is new, well decorated with lovely furniture, good bedding and a wonderful view. Waking up to a picture postcard view of palm trees, sailboats, ships and the glimmering sea makes this hotel a great choice. It doesn't get much better than this. Parking was convenient, right outside the building and doorways. The room was above average, as it was new with up scale furniture, nice light fixtures, plantation shutters, and a nice balcony, This is a two story building, but without an elevator, but does have a lovely lobby and a small swimming pool, spa, outdoor fireplace and great view of the marina. Much like one would expect at a five star hotel, only with a smaller resort feel. We felt safe. One could check out bikes, walk the boardwalk around the island. Nearby were various restaurants, such as The Brigantine. The Shelter Island and Point Loma section is very nice, older but well kept. I would highly recommend this hotel, especially if you have/rent a car. The location allows you to be able to drive to many close by tourist sites, the beaches, La Jolla, Old Town, downtown, and Seaport Village. Great hotel and very clean. You can not make a mistake staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel... Will stay again in the future”
Reviews.Author: YKennedy
Reviews.Content: WE found this hotel to be great. I went back and forth on which hotel to stay in in Dan Diego and was booked at two seperate locations. FInally decided on staying at the Island Palms. I am so glad we did. We had 3 adults and a 4 year old in the room. Though our room wasn't large it was sufficient in size for a 4 day stay. My son loved going out on the front (gate enclosed) patio area and seeing the boats. A short two minute walk lead to a playground. The pool area looked clean and nice, but I thought it was a bit on the chilly size for swimming. Overall, A+

Reviews.Title: “Great Property and Location”
Reviews.Author: rjc260
Reviews.Content: I really think Shelter Island is the place to stay in San Diego and we felt the Best Western Palms was a great choice. The island is very beautiful and a wonderful place to go for a run/walk or just sit and relax. It is a good viewing spot for naval vessels and cruise ships entering the bay. There are many restaurants and bars to choose from in the Shelter Island/Point Loma area within a short drive or long walk from the hotel (most don't stay open real late so downtown may be a better option for die hard night owls). The property is spread out over several buildings. We stayed in the Casa Del Mar Building which is a two minute walk from the lobby. The grounds are nicely appointed and a walk/run along the water is very enjoyable. The lobby has a restaurant, bar and fitness center. The fitness center was not spectacular but better than the average hotel workout room. The pool area by the main lobby was very large and tropical feeling. Our room was large and had decent quality furniture and a comfortable bed. The window and balcony opened to a nice view of the marina. The bathroom was nothing special but upkept well - the sink was in the main portion of the room rather than with the shower and toilet. We paid a rate of $99 during the week and $110 over the weekend. We found similar rates in downtown but felt this is a much better option (unless your are on business). Parking and wifi are free here as well.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great !”
Reviews.Author: plannerHaolic
Reviews.Content: What a great surprise we got when we arrived ! We stayed in the Casa del Mar section which is more recent.
